The tiny terror of the Dread Wastes, Kovok prefers a steady diet of "brain food:" mushan brains, human brains, any brains really. This strange nutritional requirement may be tangentally related to his enormous head.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Drop:|r Paragons of the Klaxxi|n|cFFFFD200Raid:|r Siege of Orgrimmar|n

Description_lang: The odd blue flames found within the Cavern of Lost Spirits have led many unwary adventurers to their doom.

When the village of Pi'jiu was attacked by the Ordon Yaungol generations ago, the villagers bravely erected a keg in the center of the village. The following morning, after the celebration had died down, the still-drunken Yaungol blearily agreed to a peace treaty.
Spineclaw crabs of Pandaria have existed for thousands of years and remain one of the continent's oldest creatures.
Gulp frogs of the Timeless Isle can feast upon prey several times larger than themselves by slowly digesting the victim externally with a toxic slime.
Some young and rambunctious hozen are trained from an early age to use boxing gloves so they don't accidentally kill their tribe members, and more importantly, to keep them from picking their noses.
One of the beasts left on the Timeless Isle when it shifted through time, most likely sacrificed by the Ordon to their demigod, Ordos.
Swarmlings of Gu'chi spin an ancient, and very powerful, form of silk that has not been seen in Pandaria in ages.
Prolonged exposure to Shaohao's tranquil mists has calmed these spirits, which act as peaceful companions to the Mistweavers.
The Jadefire Spirit is thought to be a living embodiment of Yu'lon's own jade breath.

Fed up with long hours, low pay, and entitled adventurers whining about sub-standard Winter Veil gifts, these nasty little creatures fled their magical workshops to join up with the Abominable Greench.
A candle inside of the kite heats the air, causing it to rise into the air without the need for wind.
These possessed puppets are given a semblance of life by whimsical spirits of the departed.
A mastiff bred for rescue, the Alterac brewhound's bloodline is famous for having found and resuscitated many mountain travelers trapped beneath the snow... and then slobbering all over them.
We're Crusaders from a fable. We dance whene'er we're able. We do routines and chorus scenes, with footwork impeccable!
Watch your coin purse.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Promotion:|r Diablo 3: Reaper of Souls Collector's Edition

Description_lang: Tenacious and terrible, the mighty Hogs slaughters weaker enemies without hesitation.
Both heads are equally fearsome on the terrifying chimaera, each capable of its own unique breath attack.
The dark wings will cloud and consume the minds of the weak, because they are just so adorable!
This massive weapon of destruction has been miniaturized for use in the garden.  Moles beware!
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Quest:|r Report to the King (Alliance), Warning the Warchief (Horde)|n|cFFFFD200Zone:|r Blasted Lands (90+)|n

Description_lang: Made from bits and pieces of vanquished battle pets, dark magic, and just a pinch of love.
Cute enough to eat, but not recommended.
Left to their own devices, carrots will simply lose their minds.
Squeeeeeeeawk!
A single peacock feather is often laid upon a grave to ward off evil spirits.
After many complaints that taming young boars was a painful experience, engineers came to the rescue with this creepily lifelike model.
The teroclaw is a potent hunter of the small and furry.
This adorable little elephant is always there for you.
Annoying and destructive, they can be coaxed with enough cheese to become a tolerable companion.
Zomstrok is evil incarnate, the unholy mistake of someone maddened by isolation, a creation that could not be undone.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Drop:|r Reanimated Darktide Boneshell, Darktide Husk|n|cFFFFD200Zone:|r Shadowmoon Valley|n

Description_lang: From seed to flower, a tiny terror is grown.
From seed to flower, a tiny terror is grown.
From seed to flower, a tiny terror is grown.
From seed to flower, a tiny terror is grown.
From seed to flower, a tiny terror is grown.
From seed to flower, a tiny terror is grown.
Many years ago, an ogre tried to use a leatherhide runt as kickball.  He was forever known as Onefoot afterwards.
Orcish children have a tradition where they sneak up on a mud jumper and whisper a secret they wish to come true.  If the mud jumper doesn't jump, the wish will come true.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Pet Battle: |rHighmountain, Nagrand, Spires of Arak, Talador|n

Description_lang: In the ultimate demonstration of stubborness, this once-living nannie simply refused to die.
The intelligence and caring nature of elekk calves make them a stalwart lifelong companion.
The moonshell crab reflects light so well that they can be picked up and used as a mirror.  Just keep your face away from the claws!
The sea calf has a natural affinity for balancing things.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Profession:|r Warlords of Draenor Fishing|n|cFFFFD200Vendor:|r Nat Pagle|n|cFFFFD200Zone:|r Garrison, Fishing Shack|n|cFFFFD200Cost:|r 50|Tinterface\icons\inv_misc_coin_19.blp:0|t

Description_lang: This hatchling has an unusual sense that allows it to detect and follow along with alpha predators.
While these tiny mechanical guardians were created to protect domesticated elekks from pests, they also turned out to be really good at giving back massages.
Loves to herd imps, roll around in lava, and snuggle with elemental lords.
Surprisingly quick when provoked, but easily calmed with a meal of Nagrand arrowbloom.
After consuming the shin bone of Gul'dan, this fiesty demon hunter was caged for 10000 years by his brother Murkfurion.
Camouflaged like moss, the skitterer will hide in trees and leap on their victims from above.
Their deceptively cute looks will lure in their prey, and then greet them with a flurry of devastating swipes. Hug with caution.
Equipped with extremely sharp claws, these frigid hatchlings dig through thick layers of ice and rock for shelter.
One ogre ritual involves cupping a bone wasp in their hands and shaking vigorously.  The venom increases strength and invokes vivid imagery.
Contrary to popular belief, bloodsting wasps do not feed on blood, but love.
Wood wasps make nests in dead or hollowed out trees, and are quick to attack anything that threatens their home.
In the moonlight their wings create a glittering aura, giving the illusion of twinkling starlight.
Amberbarbs often try to provoke larger creatures to attack it. Once their victim strikes them, they will retaliate with the entire hive.
This magical kitty has so much energy that she will sometimes zip around for no reason whatsoever.
The Sky-Bo was originally designed by the infamous Millie Watt as a toy for her cat.  The cat just slept in the box next to it.
The ancient tribes of Draenor were known to harvest their sharp beaks for crude tools and weapons.
The colorful plumage from these birds are highly sought after by collectors. It is rumored that wearing these feathers will bring you good luck.
The edges of its beak are particularly sharp. Watch your fingers during feeding time!
This anxious avian has a voracious appetite for fruit.
This tiny squid seems to enjoy wearing pants, but where in the world would you find some that fit?
They eat and eat and eat, until they grow large.  Then they eat some more.
Of course there are hatchlings, they're called Lovebirds aren't they?
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200World Event:|r Love is in the Air|n|cFFFFD200Vendor: |rLovely Merchant|n|cFFFFD200Cost: |r40|TINTERFACE\ICONS\INV_ValentinesCard01:0|t

Description_lang: Animated by magical means, and chlorophyll.
The master-crafted gear assembly and precision joints in this robot are clearly made with love.
Following their introduction to the mainland by the goblins, Bush Chickens have become the entre du jour for Pilgrim's Bounty due to their high deliciousness and low intelligence.
Tiny, incinerated corpses of various insects line its cage.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200World Event:|r Midsummer Fire Festival|n|cFFFFD200Vendor: |rMidsummer Merchant, Midsummer Supplier|n|cFFFFD200Cost: |r350|TINTERFACE\ICONS\INV_SummerFest_FireFlower:0|t

Description_lang: The Pandaren Brewmasters accidentally brought a barrel of Uncle Gao's last sentient batch of brew with them to Brewfest.
One of this cat's nine lives has returned to haunt the living by yowling loudly when you're trying to sleep.
Not even death would stop this kitten's insatiable curiosity.
This slime has a long and confusing lineage.

The little wolf told to stay.
Watching, waiting, for vacant prey.
Too proud to leave, she slipped away.
Unburdened now, forever free to play.
The ancient nest guardian was designed with the unthinkable in mind: to hate cats.
Kaliri hatchlings feast on grubs when they're young, and eventually graduate to anything smaller than themselves.
No one knows what deep part of Blackwing Descent the Lanticore was kept in, but it probably smelled pretty awful.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Drop:|r The Lanticore|n|cFFFFD200Zone:|r Upper Black Rock Spire

Description_lang: In Draenor, the Zangar Sea seeks to overtake the land by releasing thousands of these spores and slowly growing inland over time.
A spore plucked from the Crimson Fen, an area of Gorgrond that was swallowed when Draenor was torn apart by nether magics.
The deep blue Umbrafen would later become home to a tribe of Broken.
A spore from Zangarra, a central area of the Zangar encroachment that would later bloom into the Zangarmarsh.
Brilliant spores are very rarely seen, found deep under the waves of Draenor within the darkest corners of the Zangar fungal encroachment.
The hydraling can be an expensive pet, as it is capable of eating from three food bowls at the same time.
These pups are bundles of fur and teeth until they grow up, at which point they are really just teeth.
Originally bred to make milk more palatable for gnomes.
His hate is not diminished by size.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Drop:|r Ragnaros the Firelord|n|cFFFFD200Zone:|r Molten Core (Anniversary Edition)

Description_lang: Don't line her cage with paper unless you want a fire.
Half bird, half elemental, the beautiful Stormwing is truly capable of shock and awe.
The Bronze Whelpling was lost in time until an unusual event allowed her to escape.
A clear indication why goblin fertilizers should be used sparingly.
Iron, iron, steel and fire.  Bellows, gears, plates, and wire.
These tiny creatures seem to favor big, fluffy nests, preferably atop an animal-loving dryad.
The companion of a night elf sentinel, rarely given out as a gift.
Living so closely to the water's surface, the puddle terror is not only friend to all aquatic creatures, it is one.
When forging enchanted steel, bits of magic seep into the coals.  Over a period of years, decades even, the unbound energy slowly takes form, creating a tiny elemental being of immense fortitude.
Legend says the Sunfire Kaliri flies into the sun itself when it is ready to die.
Their white hide would make them vulnerable to sunburn, if it wasn't as thick as plate armor.
The bloodfeather is completely fearless, fanning out its feathers and charging any threat.
It's said the feathers glitter like gold when the rising sun shines upon them.
Godlike being now in travel size.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Vendor: |rRavenspeaker Skeega|n|cFFFFD200Zone: |rWarspear|n|cFFFFD200Faction: |rArakkoa Outcasts - Revered|n|cFFFFD200Cost: |r1000|TINTERFACE\MONEYFRAME\UI-GOLDICON.BLP:0|t|n|n|cFFFFD200Vendor: |rShadow-Sage Brakoss|n|cFFFFD200Zone: |rStormshield|n|cFFFFD200Faction: |rArakkoa Outcasts - Revered|n|cFFFFD200Cost: |r1000|TINTERFACE\MONEYFRAME\UI-GOLDICON.BLP:0|t

Description_lang: Playing fetch with a ray is always fun.  You don't even have to aim.
You'll always feel like... something is watching you.
Ravagers are favored ogre snacks when they are small and less deadly.
The frostshell pinchers build up layers of ice to give them the extra protection from larger predators.
With claws that can crush a platemail gauntlet, it's best to handle with care.
These crafty crustaceans burrow under the mud to avoid being scooped up by larger predators.
They feed off of the nutrient-rich fungal spores which gives these crabs the district coloring of their shells.
They will cover themselves in seaweed and other ocean foliage to get the upper claw on their prey.
Delicate and dangerous, brilliant and bold, a beauty worth more than gold.
Their deep purple wings are highly sought after by ogre magi believing that they can bring prolonged life when added to potions.
Their wings emit a fine powder as a defensive mechanism when it is in danger.
Delicate and dangerous, brilliant and bold, a beauty worth more than its weight in gold.  Too bad they are so light.
Scholars have debated at length about how fireflies glow, but the leading hypothesis is "magic".
These fireflies retain their purple glow by eating only purple flowers and nectar.
It has been referred to as "the flying gem" due to its similar luster to the finest of sapphires.
The watefly uses the surface of the water to reflect the light from their abdomen to attract mates.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Pet Battle: |r Shadowmoon Valley, Talador, Tanaan Jungle

Description_lang: Surprisingly quick when provoked, but easily calmed with a meal of Nagrand arrowbloom.
Surprisingly quick when provoked, but easily calmed with a meal of Nagrand arrowbloom.
Hunted to near extinction for its feathers, this kaliri has developed keen senses.
Hunted to near extinction for its feathers, the kaliri has developed keen senses.
Wild sporebats are vicious creatures, but if tamed at a young age, they can be loyal companions.
Wild sporebats are vicious creatures, but if tamed at a young age, they can be loyal companions.
Young bone serpents will try to burrow into a living creature's skull and devour their brain.  So you may want to wear a night cap.

Description_lang: Demidos created a great many servants when he was hosting parties for other void lords.
No matter how much he screams, never give him demon blood.
Often caught chewing on things they shouldn't be, goats were initially blamed for the crash of the Exodar.
The lost magical light of a Dalaran mage, or sentient candle with a positive attitude? You decide.
A magical friend created with equal parts adventure and spirit.
Not only is it quick, it's loud too!
A smaller gargoyle that is used to divert the flow of rainwater on scourge buildings to prevent mausoleum flooding.
The dark green water in the Black Temple's sewer system gives these hydras their distinctive color.
A fragment of the great abyssal Supremus, Abyssius contains enough fiery essence to burn a hole right through your pocket.
It's just a little mad.
It's only mildly irritated.
It's only somewhat interested.
She's the devil on your shoulder, whispering in your ear.
What's that smell?
Hundreds of these wisps came together to defend Hyjal from Archimonde and save the world.
Because you don't want to know what happens when a rat wanders into the Sunwell.
The Twisting Nether is an infinite abyss of terrors and one small corner of extreme cuteness.
Magic-addicted elves too small and frail to serve in Kil'Jaeden's army were relegated to servant roles for the higher-class demons.
When this pet is near, calming chimes fill your mind and remind you of a time long passed.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Achievement: |rRaiding with Leashes III: Drinkin' From the Sunwell|n|cFFFFD200Category: |rCollect

Description_lang: One of the Darkmoon Race's most obnoxious obstacles, now in the palm of your hand!

In one invasion of the Haunted Mines, a team of heroes only managed to collect a single skull. The golem that resulted, too small to do much damage to the enemy towers, wandered off into the Nexus, eventually finding its way to Azeroth.
The rivers of Draenor are filled with moray.  They are vicious predators, attacking anything that enters the water.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Pet Battle:|r Erris the Collector, Kura Thunderhoof|n

Description_lang: Rumor has it that some beasts that were touched by the void exist in a space between this world and the next.
Found munching on a blackened bone in the Black Forge of Blackrock Foundry, this pup really seems to warm up to you quickly.
These playful little riverbeasts enjoy scooping up a large mouthful of water and then spitting it at one another.
Once a holy artifact used by draenei priests to calm spirits, it has become animated by anguished souls and drawn to locations of death and corruption.
These crabs have developed an advanced form of camouflage that causes their skin to appear translucent.
This fish doesn't seem to respond to your commands at all, or notice that you're there, really.
There is very little difference between a corrupted nest guardian and an omelette chef.
Who would leave such a cute shark behind? The Iron Horde truly has no soul.
Found wandering in a small blizzard, this lost goren carries a mining pick to show that he is a jack of all trades.
A small amount of Cyrukh burns everlasting within this portion of the Cipher. Best keep it close to you.
This young stalker was easily swayed from Sargeras' grasp by a handful of Magical Mini-Treats.
Pets often look a lot like their owners, which is especially true if the owner was a saberon.
Arakkoa sun worship has resulted in the creation of some strange and monstrous minions.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Vendor: |rDawn-Seeker Krisek|n|cFFFFD200Zone: |rTanaan Jungle|n|cFFFFD200Faction: |rOrder of the Awakened - Exalted

Description_lang: Strega the Hag enchanted her cauldron to prevent it from tipping over and spilling hot soup.  She never expected it to achieve sentience and attempt to murder her.
Strega the Hag didn't like carrying her own torches.  One quick enchantment, and the thing would dutifully follow her into the night.
Strega the Hag, tired of writing thank you notes, used her magic to automate the task.  Unfortunately, the pen had a dark side and all the recipients received strongly worded letters...
You saved him, but maybe he saved you.
This little guy has had a rough start at life, be sure to take good care of him.
Many sailors believe that harming an albatross will bring terrible luck upon their voyage.

While other species of birds take turns leading the flock during migration, the kingfeather always remains in the lead.  Whether this is an effort to help the rest of the flock conserve energy or out of dominance remains unknown.
Always in its brother's shadow.
A very rare bird, but this one was intrusted to you.
These birds often prey on turtles by dropping them from great heights to break open their shell.
Its eyesight is better than its hearing.
Its sharp eyes can spot a snowshoe rabbit in a snowstorm.
These creatures can hunt in almost pure darkness.
A young companion in need of training.
What was once a great enemy is now an adorable friend!
What are YOU looking at?!
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Order Hall:|r Dreadscar Rift, The Fel Hammer

Description_lang: Hello. Is it me you're looking for?
The great-great-great-great-great granddaughter of Senegos.
Its scales are electrified, making it exceedingly tricky to cuddle.
Beautiful dreamer, wake unto me, Starlight and dewdrops are waiting for thee.
What's a little corruption between friends?
Grumplings are created when the tears of a kidnapped child fall upon a mound of new snow.
The front legs of this spider are almost indestructable, allowing it to burrow into almost any surface.
Why is it called a nursery spider? Does it prefer to lurk in nurseries? Why would it do that? What does it do there? Oh, dear! Someone check on the kids!
Juvenile describes this scuttleback's age, not its maturity.
Olivetail is a bit of misnomer, as its whole body is just brown...
As if a mine full of non-ghost spiders wasn't scary enough.
It's just like a regular spider, but fel.
On very rare occasions glowflies synchronize their flashing creating a spectacular sight for any adventurer lucky enough to catch this phenomenon.
The terror larva seeks a host to feed on their dreams and terrors. Soon the larva will grow into the host's worst fears.

These snakes are extraordinarily docile creatures.  However, they blend with their environment so well that many adventurers tread too closely to a nest.  Most bites result from totally avoidable incidents.
Vale flitter normally have incredibly long lifespans.  That was until people found use for them in pet battles.
Is it three white stripes on a brown tail, or two brown stripes on a white tail?
Striders glow brightest during spring, hence the name.
If a live maggot eats the dead, what does an undead maggot eat?
By far the best way to spread the plague of undeath.
Often it is red-footed after it catches its prey.
It disappears as quietly and mysteriously as the mist.
The last thing you'll see is a streak of red.
It's more cute than spooky.
Like father, like son.
Oddly, he was named Crispin even before the incident.
When a helsquid has devoured most of the food in any area, it can return to its polyp form and begin life anew.
Dalaran's drainage is not as good as you think.
Once its tentacles take hold there is no escape, much like its love for you.
He loves to play in the mud! Then he likes to give you a hug!
The formula had a bit too much... purple.
Even piglets are not safe from the Legion's corruption.  Although, this one seems harmless enough.
Most bats are not blind, except this one.  This one is blind.
Never say "oink" in its presence.
Its traveled all the way from New Beavertown.
Energized by the ogre-mages of Highmaul, this mana-hungry creature will drain you dry before you know it.
A shimmering creature made of pure arcane energy, it is hard to focus your eyes directly on it.
First created in the presence of Highmaul runes, this tiny manafiend really packs a punch!
Mages seek these manafiends to absorb their ley energies.
Once a manafiend consumes enough ley energy, it becomes more aggressive and twisted.  Approach with extreme caution.
Even in its juvenile stage, this crab's pincers can break bone.
Guess what its bed is. A piece of bread.
I am Broot.
This very elusive creature likes to hide in places where many adventurers don't frequently travel.
After a long night out mages find that their water elementals smell a bit off.
Leaving the forest to see the world, which must look so much bigger to such a little guy.
Eternally cute.
For Sale: Slightly used Alarm-o-Bot. Rebuilt and refurbished. Still annoying.
Don't want to break the bank on that new robot? Have a little helper at half the cost! Come down to Goblin Experimental Engineering Korporation and put in your order! All sales final.
You can identify the cruelest and most vicious of the brood by their reddish hue.
When demons, nightmares, and magic collide!
Its proximity to crystalline mana clusters has hardened this broodlings body to an almost rocklike state.
These creatures have developed a chitin armor around its fangs, legs and abdomen.
An intelligent ape that claims he is from 'the moon'. Does he mean the White Lady, or the Blue Child?

Description_lang: Isn't baby elderhorn an oxymoron?
Val'kyr are considered "sunborne" when they are honored in the presence of Odyn.
Ever wanted to cuddle with a gun? Introducing Trigger, the Cuter Shooter.
In his home realm, he commanded an army of ten million demons. Now his power is yours to command. Go make him fight a chicken!
How the Mad Merchant got his hands on one of these otherworldly creatures is unknown. What we do know is, he knows it's valuable.
A felbat's fire never burns its master.
His tiny legs make him more aerodynamic.
He may not be the fastest snail, but he has the heart of a champion.
No size jokes, please.
These fast and nimble swimmers are highly desired by pet collectors. Though they can appear friendly, their tail stinger can kill on contact.
Mmm... Pizza!
Now, where are its parents? You monster.
It enjoys long walks on the beach.
Do you see how they run?
This creature was once a normal beaver, but was struck by lightning, a stormwing drake's breath, and a rock all at the same time.
Maybe a bit too enthusiastic.

Description_lang: Thousands of years ago, ten magisters were exiled from Highborne society for seeking power in the corrupting darkness. In the wilds, they found hunger, desperation, and Kosumoth.
One of Ash'alah's litter, entrusted to you by the Dreamweavers.
Fire it up!
True royalty among Corgis.
Fond of slithering through tight spaces, these sea creatures lurk in the wreckage of sunken ships.
Ghosts are voracious readers.
A lasher by any other name would smell as sweet.
Didn't play nice with the other plants in the nursery.
Younger brother to Anax.  Big brother to Cenax and Denax.
During a special time of year, a secretive clan of murlocs often sends young tadpoles out to explore, adventure, and begin their tale.
This ferocious feline followed the fel forces into Azeroth during the Legion's return.
A magical wisdom-filled head in a ball bearing Khadgar's visage, it can only answer questions with a few phrases.
With enough of your love, and tiny milk bottles, she will grow strong enough to rejoin the wild.
A proud supporter of the Horde, this tiny murloc left his clutch to seek out blue-clad foes to slay.
A tiny admirer of the Alliance, this courageous murloc made his own sword and shield to slay red-clad foes.
A pup of Thrall's frostwolf, Snowsong, besting her in combat has earned you a lifelong companion.
Why do bunnies lay eggs?
Who's ready for a hot stone massage?

Description_lang: Deep beneath the Argent Tournament grounds a clutch of eggs belonging to mates Acidmaw and Dreadscale was found.
Really much more tolerable when he's not riding on your head.
Thousands of these skittering nightmares swarm underneath Northrend to this day.
In the eternal balance of frost and fire, the raging flames fuel many aggressive fronts.
The denizens of Ulduar transformed even small whelps into ironclad monstrosities.
The runeforged sentries of Ulduar march endlessly without the need for rest or recharging.
Rub its belly more than twice and you're just asking to be pounced on.
In the eternal balance of frost and fire, the stolid ice forms a defense without measure.
Glowing from within, these sprouts have been blessed with a gift from Eonar.
The next level of scrapbot technology: pushes the scrap into a heap, then destroys it with flame vents and rockets.
There is something deeply unsettling about the tentacle, perhaps it is best not to look at it for too long.
A small fragment of Lord Marrowgar, it will NOT stop assaulting your shins.
It really seems to want to touch you, but why?
The eternal answer to the question 'what's that smell?'
The Lich King tore the spirits of Sindragosa's lost whelps into undeath in front of her skeletal form as a final affront to the great dragon.
One of innumerable ghouls summoned by the Lich King in his final battle, left to roam the world for eternity.
An unrepentant soul that was once trapped inside Frostmourne, and now flits restlessly between worlds.
In the end, we are all wrought from stardust.
Snowfeather falcosaur hatchlings instinctively flee to nearby adults when threatened. The species is particularly fond of large prey.
Direbeak falcosaurs are heartier than other falcosaur species, but cannot smell as well. They prefer pungent meals and will often eat carrion that has been sitting in the sun for days.
Sharptalon falcosaurs can subsist entirely on a diet of small nuts and berries, and use their talons mostly for defense.
Though they may look fierce, the bloodgazer species of falcosaur has a beak that makes it predisposed to consuming fruits.
After witnessing your heroism in battle, this squire promised you an oath of fealty.

They say Fleet Admiral Tethys was never without his trusty parrot by his side - or on his shoulder. Tethys could always call him with a whistle.
In the fertile grounds of the Wailing Caverns, nothing truly dies.
This serpent seems used to being at your side, it may have been the companion of one of the other druids of the fang.
Untouched by the deviate corruption seeping through the Wailing Caverns.
This tiny robot specializes in drilling, clamping, and shooting lightning out of its brain. A typical gnome invention.
It's just constantly barfing plague fluid. Where does it come from? Where does it go?
Crafted by a great and powerful wizard who refused to wear robes with pockets.
How do you kill that which lives in garbage?
The infinite dragonflight is far more diverse than most denizens of Azeroth know.
It is a riddle wrapped in a mystery inside an enigma.
A terror so terrible, you're amazed it could ever be real.

Description_lang: Unlike other wyrms, blood wyrms drain their foes rather than consuming them whole.
Among the Death Knight's forces, the frost wyrm is the most formidable. This whelpling is no different.
Biohazard. Handle with gloves.
Mr. Smite kept this in his trunk, but always seemed to prefer his hammer. Seems like a mistake in hindsight.
He's one cowardly companion, because he's got no guts...
Though they may look fierce, the bloodgazer species of falcosaur has a beak that makes it predisposed to consuming fruits.
Introducing the youngest member of the Xuen Dynasty! Daughter of Ban-Lu. Niece of Xu-Fu. Granddaughter of the celestial Xuen... It's Ban-Fu!
Such a good boy.
He's very friendly, but any amount of snuggles is going to result in you getting a nasty shock.
Sure are a lot of these around the Broken Shore.
This energetic kitten changes colors depending on its mood.
He'll plunder your provolone, turn your ship to swiss, then get your gouda. He's a true muenster and the scourge of the seven bries.
The earliest prototype of the deadly Foe Reaper.
Lost on Argus and overtaken by darkness, this playful fox can shrug off the void just by being by your side.
This marmot has been with you this entire time. He's that good.
Best keep him away from any cannons.
Rogues often kept a few of these in their pockets in times of emergency. Don't ask me why.
The Bronze Proto-Whelps have been discovered only in the most peculiar of timelines.
This particular drake has oddly retained its age throughout its travels, but its size has certainly changed.
Queen Azshara's curse over the denizens of Azsuna did not only affect the night elves. This shark is doomed to an eternity of bottomless hunger.
During their years-long war with the black dragonflight, the dwarves tried crafting smaller golems that were more difficult to hit.
Maloriak was nothing if not resourceful, not letting even small scraps of flesh go to waste.
Nefarian's reanimated bone constructs were an effective way to combat the many adventurers that plagued him, and especially their mages.
Even very small things can be corrupted, the apocalypse is for everyone.
Amongst the rudest of the Twilight's Hammer's corrupting activities was binding the elements of small streams and brooks.
It has no eyes, but it always seems to be staring at you.
A minor diety of wind, lording over the tiny breezes that make you think the heat of the summer season will be bearable for a brief moment.
If you feel a slight gust that made you shiver, that was probably Drafty.
Some say it's the pup of Riplimb and Rageface, others say 'I don't want to think about that.'
A rarely-seen cinderweb species known for devouring her mate's legs and laying eggs in his still-twitching body, and a lovely purple color.
Five things he can never do without: surging, surging, surging, surging, surging.
During his time in the Firelands, Fandral would often grow bored and work shaping magic on the local flora and fauna.
Can't quite take over your mind, but capable of giving you a really bad migraine.
Some fragments of Deathwing's blood live on to this day, deep within the lost places of the world, forever seeking their lost host.
Its friends call it "Slappy."
Infused with the elementium ore used to plate the great dragon Deathwing, and one of the last remnants of the madness that nearly consumed Azeroth.
While most of the marsuul on Argus feed on fruits, this particular one prefers the juicy crunch of small rodents.
Who makes them? How do they get there? No one knows, except maybe Greatfather Winter.
I always feel like somebody's watching me.
It's not really an orphan. The name just makes you feel better about abducting it.
Beautiful and deadly.
Skyfin can be observed in a wide variety of colors. Biologists believe the vibrancy of those colors both help attract mates and ward predators.
Watch out when it spits.
Reaching out from some vast unknown corner of the void... to give you a hug.
If a bile larva stays burrowed for an extended period of time they begin to lose their pigment. When they finally do emerge, they can be quite ravenous.
Proximity to Antorus makes these larva hyper agressive.
An early stage of the bilescourge life cycle.
The final phase of the bilescourge life cycle.
Bilescourge mostly feed on the corpses of victims of the Legion. However, since your arrival, it has developed a taste for demon corpses as well.
Born from the crash site of the Xenedar on Argus.
While there are many similarities to the warpstalkers from Azeroth, evidence suggests they evolved completely independently from one another. Fascinating!
The void can consume life or meld with it. The latter often has unpercieved consequences.
You have the odd feeling that it wants to kill you.
Mana wyrm used to thrive on Argus many millennia ago, but lots has changed since those halcyon days.
If mana becomes scarce these wyrm look for other sources of energy to feed on.
It likes to be petted behind the fins.
Skyfin can fly from birth and there are some observed cases of mothers giving birth midflight!
What are they rebelling against? The real question is what are they NOT rebelling against.
Uuna was found bound to an Ur'zul, and was released into the Shadowlands, where she wandered in the utter darkness.
Tottle's one wish is to explore the world at your side!
Unfortunately, it's not a duck.
This young crawgling was rescued from a vicious blood troll war camp. With care, and lots of feeding, you earned his trust and Krag'wa asked you to take care of him always.

The Postmaster is often described as esoteric, mystical, even inexplicable. For the precious little known about the enigmatic mail-master, perhaps none outside of the wax seal can confirm the existence of the fantastical letter-loving Mailemental.
This silithid battle tank evolved prematurely. It will never reach full size, but it is just as ferocious as its larger cousins.
Francois, a pompous member of the bockgeoisie, whose wealth and influence was born from the exploitation and labor of the peckletariat.
When Whomper wants to play, he'll let you know with a playful headbutt.
Don't say anything to Cap'n Crackers that you don't want repeated to you every day for the next 20 years.

Not much is known about the great snake Merektha and the many eggs in the Temple of Sethraliss, but the residents of Zandalar all seem to have a distinct amount of both respect and fear for these serpents.
You're not entirely sure where this came from, nor do you really want to know, but you are sure that it does eat a tremendous amount of garbage.
Poda was just a small part of the larger business, always trying to live up to the standards of his older brother Coda.
Smoochums loved life in Glenbrook, it was full of people to play with and places to sleep, and also where unspeakable acts happen at the most innocent of tea parties.
A newly hatched Cobra can be just as deadly as a fully grown one, if not more.
The wisest engineers of Azeroth all know that the only thing more dangerous than a living evil chicken, is the mind of an evil chicken transplanted into the body of a mechanical chicken.
Most predators favored the soft parts of their prey to attack first.  Lil' Tika prefers to go for the face.

The Direhorn species is among the toughest and strongest of all things that walk on Azeroth. They can seem like gentle giants, but be cautious that you don't find yourself in front of one when they are on a warpath.
Taptaf is loyal beyond a doubt, as long as food is provided.
The Drustvar people learned over time that when burying someone or some thing that there are sadly a number of shady people looking to exhume and reanimate whatever they can find.
The Zandalari are masters of magic and communications with the spirits, and they often imbued items with powers to strengthen their bonds with the spirit world.
The mummy's wraps serves two purposes, one being to keep everything inside intact, the other is to lessen the fright of people seeing what's really below the wrappings.
Not much is known about this otherworldly minion.
Even the toughest of crabs with the toughest of shells can succumb to the dark mysteries of the shadows.
The river frogs of Stormsong Valley have been known to try to hypnotize people by staring directly into their eyes and making a low rumbling noise.
The hermit crabs of Stormsong Valley will use whatever they can find that fits them for their shell.  If it fits, they sits.

Vale Marmots are very quick on their feet and are masters of digging holes for their burrows.  Children like to chase them around and try to bop them on the head when they poke their head out to catch some sunlight.
Long ago, the population of chickens in Stormsong Valley was so high, there was fear that the chickens would eat all of the corn from the fields and leave the other residents hungry.
The sandyback crawlers get their name from having a slightly sticky outer shell that sand sticks to as they walk around.
River otters start growing whiskers at a very young age and never stop.  By the time they are fully grown and reach old age, they have more whiskers on their face than any other known creature.
It is rumored that these honey bees can detect the pollen of a newly blossomed plant in northern Stormsong Valley when they are all the way down in Drustvar.
The stinger of a Ravager Wasp can cause intense pain for up to three hours.  Consult a physician immediately if stung.
Shack crabs are the only species of hermit crabs known to regenerate limbs if torn off in battle.
The mucus secreted from inland croakers is so effective at repelling water, the ship builders of Kul Tiras have been using it in the wood sealant for many years.
The giant woodworm can burrow into almost any surface they crawl on, except solid stone.
Butterflies taste with their feet! I tried it once, but I only made a mess.
The 'door ditch' prank is not as effective when the house can chase you.
The purple coloration helps this species blend into the rocks and shadows, but the crabs become easy prey for seagulls when they linger too long on the open sand.
Many ancient tribes revered these enormous beetles.
While completely harmless to trolls, the animal life within Nazmir fear these creatures.
Water Skimmers use the tension of water and long, hydrophobic legs to help them walk along the water's surface.
When perched on a tree, this species can be almost invisible to any prey.
This species looks through the sand for the buried remains of rotting creatures. It keeps our beaches clean!
It's a repulsive creature. No one should want this.
A terror in life. A terror in death.
Apply directly to the forehead.
Suddenly there came a tapping...
How many bogs has it hopped? No one knows.
When you're a hoarder, but want to stay on the move!
A quite annoying species. No matter how high you build your walls, these creatures still manage to hop over.
Built to dig holes by a gnomish farmer, Rooter quickly and predictably went haywire, with disastrous results.
Built with ever-wagging tail technology, Brutus is a mechanically-certified good boy.
When the Naga invaded Stormsong, they brought their favored pets: Abyssal Eels.
These hardy bees form the backbone of a great honey and mead industry. For decades, the Tidesages forbade anyone from taking them outside of Stormsong.
Corlain Falcons are trained from birth to be scouts and fighting companions. The few spared from the Heartsbane curse serve the Order of Embers in the same capacity.
This piglet avoided being turned into sausage at the hands of Roland with the help of a cunning spider.
This red-nosed bunny is incredibly soft to the touch; just watch your fingers.
Silver dust sparkling on each of this spider's legs attracts prey; unwittingly drawn into an inescapable web.
Best not to park your mount beneath this one.
This adorable mass of whirlers, cogs, and sprockets wasn't assembled in Gnomeregan. Where then?
She loves tummy rubs. Just watch out for splinters.
A popular pet among children, despite frequent accidental gorings.
Known to chomp on the shins of everything from saurids to brutosaurs.
Exceptionally squishy, especially after a big meal.
Krag'wa reluctantly sent Tragg to the Talanji Expedition with the hope that they could find someone suitable to escort him on a tour of Azeroth.
White Brutosaurs were on the brink of extinction until some enterprising adventurers took action. Lil' Ben'fon may have inherited her father's size, but definitely has her mother's temper!
Always hungry, and has a shockingly good personality.
The scavenger Loa thinks you can teach this saurid a thing or two. Just don't lose sight of your coin purse.
These toads do not appreciate having their legs pulled off.
No one knows where this haunted tiki mask came from, or why its so angry all the time. It seems to like you though!
They are so cute before they develop razor-sharp teeth and venom.

Description_lang: This horrific, flesh-eating plant promises it can make all of your wildest wishes come true. If you feed it.
A chip off the ol' girl's block. Azeriti is fiercely protective and will strike out against anyone wishing to do her mother harm.

The platysaur species has been roaming around the lands since before time was even measured. An ancient species that has adapted to walking on the land, and also for some reason has adapted to repeating some short sounds three times in a row.
The Dreadticks have grown to be a very invasive and dominant species wherever they wind up, they are incredibly quick to assault any new species until they find a weakness to exploit.
The young of Arathi Highlands' plains spiders may kick clouds of barbed abdomen hairs into predators' eyes. All this, and poisonous web-spitters, too.
So long as one of his Sproutlings remains, Branchlord Aldrus will never truly die.
Either Darbel Montrose was a terrible warlock, or she simply adored cute things. Perhaps both.
Constructs designed to assist the titans with sundry small tasks, this example is oddly small. Teeny Titan Orb! Let's Go!
While Yogursa managed to survive the blight infesting many of Hillsbrad's ursines, she was driven mad, and her cubs forever tainted.
Part owl, part bear... and part stag, which handily avoids potential lawsuits.
Plaguefeather and her brood feed well on the carrion the battle for Stromgarde has left scattered across the Highlands.
These drops of Azerite are volatile and prone to explosive reactions when prodded.
A living piece of Arathi's most infamous stone-faced behemoth, Fozruk.
Boulderfist legend recounts a cloud of carrion birds following ogre warriors through the Dark Portal during the Second War; it may be that all two-headed scavengers in Azeroth are their descendants.
Bumbles may not have been the largest bee of the millions within the hive, but that doesn't mean he can't grow into a champion.
A mighty war machine of adorable proportions.
A mighty war machine of adorable proportions.
Scuttle was named after the ships he destroys, not his movement patterns, and don't you forget it.
The shells of this particular group of crabs shimmer like gems on the sand.
The kindleweb spider species is known amongst the island tribes for its warm, threadable webbing.
The hooves of this subgroup of goats have evolved to be equally surefooted on sand or stone.
Someone put this mechanical gorilla on the island to monitor the species, but who, and why?
The only balls this hound chases are diamond-hard, fireproof rocks. Very heavy, not fun to throw.
Is that a venomous worm in your pocket or... why is that in your pocket?
Poro cannot fly, but enjoys a long lifespan hopping along the ground and shaking the fruits from trees.
Even young brineshell are drawn to the line in the sky that meets the waves, it calls them.
Based on the size, the mantid appear to be re-growing their swarm, likely due to the presence of a new empress.
Captain Nibs was once the leader of an ill-fated sea voyage of slightly-too-smart-for-their-own-good monkeys that quickly capsized.
A wealthy pirate captain met with a strange man on the docks of an unknown city and bartered for everlasting life for his faithful companion. As with most monkey-related wishes, something went wrong.
The coldlight once were quite common across the oceans, to the grumbles of many hunters, but no longer.
Getting just one of these fragrant beasts damp is the olfactory equivalent to rolling around in a pile of wet dogs.
Particularly partial to coastal scrub grasses, this hardy species has survived many years in uncharted lands.
The voru'kar are fiercely loyal to their leader, Vorus'arak, who led them to safety from the Lich King's grasp.
Whatever the story of his mysterious eyepatch is, he's not talking.
A baby octopode is technically referred to as a "squish."
During the warm summer months, the noise that these pests make is enough to drive a person mad.
It's sting is worse than... well nothing, really. Are you sure you want to keep this as a pet?
You know how disappointing it is when you return to your beverage and the ice has all melted? This guy's fault.
The most nefarious of the trickster spirits, and the reason why the pandaren invented fireproof pants.
"Beware the cool breeze, for it brings trickery." - pandaren proverb
The earth that's rumbling beneath your feet... is it quaking or laughing, or both?
The sprites that inhabit the islands of the Great Sea have thought of many traps to lure in unwary visitors.
Littlehoof likes: bounding, bouncing, frolicking, and headbutts, in that order.
Wear gloves with this little guy, he loves to bite!
The bright scales of this rare wind serpent soak up the sunlight to keep it warm, even in shade.
Mechanical Toads can hop over seven million times before their gears begin to wear out.
These creatures are able to control each arm individually, which allows for great multi-tasking, and the ability to give the best hugs.
The smallest of cuts can be devastating to this species, they start to leak all over the place.
The horns of a crawg grow at a tremendous rate starting almost immediately after they are born, and is among the hardest of natural materials found on a living species.
No one knows who first started dressing up crabs in Azeroth, and it won't be stopping any time soon.

A Darkmoon balloon made to look like a wolf.
A Darkmoon balloon made to look like a murloc.
A Darkmoon balloon made to look like a horse.
The tarantulas that inhabit southern Redridge are smaller than their cousins elsewhere in Azeroth, but make up for their size with speed and ferocity.
Thought to be lost in a massive explosion, the smartest of engineers were able to rebuild Feathers into a magnificent mechanical creation.

Description_lang: There is a story told to some children that all winged creatures were unable to fly until Pa'ku provided enough wind to lift them off of the ground.
A toad with Krag'wa's bloodline has an average expectancy to leap over seven million times during its lifetime.
The large plates on the back of this lizard are made of a mysterious but highly conductive material, making it ideal to charge up and expel massive amounts of electricity.

The Mechantula was created by an unknown gnomish Engineer. Rumor has it when the original schematic was found, it was in a room covered with dusty old webbing, but neither the original Mechantula or the engineer who drafted the schematic could be found.
Mechanical Cockroaches are less likely to survive an apocalypse than an actual living cockroach, making this one of the more questionable feats of engineering.
The radiation from all of the machinery in Gnomeregan gives these rats a soft green glow when looked at in absolute darkness.
The Alarm-O-Dog was built for security purposes, but people really wanted one for their home because they are so darn cute.
Nobody is sure why someone thought making a miniature version of the machines in Gnomeregan was a good idea, but they sure are fun to play with.
The eerie magic in Drustvar has caused some unimaginable creatures to show up. Some still lurk in the shadows, others seem to be made out of shadows.

The raptors of Zandalar have their feathers at a very young age, making them seem like easy prey to an unsuspecting predator. In reality, these little terrors eat everything they want to and are prey to almost no other species.
Like many other species, you can get a rough guess of how large the raptor will be as a fully grown adult by the size of its largest claw.

One of the earliest recorded victories in a large battle on Zandalar depicted mighty warriors riding into battle on armored raptors. The legend has it that the warrior did not choose their raptor, but that the raptor would choose the warrior.
During certain times of the day, the sunlight can cause a reflection on the feathers of the red tinted raptors causing them to look more like flames than feathers.
This upper class parrot is only for the most distinguished of sailors.
The Sentinel Owls of Darkshore are forever protective of their homeland.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Drop:|r Burninator Mark V|n|cFFFFD200Zone:|r Darkshore|n|n|cFFFFD200Drop:|r Athil Dewfire|n|cFFFFD200Zone:|r Darkshore

Description_lang: When Cyclarus came to Darkshore, small cyclones appeared all over the place. Some of them dissipated over time, others found their way back to Cyclarus and were absorbed into the surrounding winds.
This is what happens when you try to one-up Pip Quickwit's tall tales of being stuck inside of dangerous creatures.
Hydrath Water Droplets are also an excellent skin moisturizer.
A lone Ancient of Lore in Darnassus managed to save this Treant in its final actions with a magical aura to prevent the flames from burning it any further.
This Jelly has seen better days. Now it sees through fifty different eyes.
Once a mighty warrior of the n'raqi, Zur'aj's power was stolen and absorbed by an unknown rival.
The playful kicks of these baby moose are enough to knock an orc flat on his back.
We don't know much about this species, but we do know this: bats aren't bugs.
Get it while it lasts.
The needleback porcupines have survived life in island climates by evolving to be extra lucky.
Albino ravens are incredibly rare and highly prized amongst the traders of the Great Sea.
Though barely a hatchling, its claws are already sharp enough to pierce the flesh of many smaller critters.
Firesting wasps are said to have one of the worst bites of any wasp species, causing a pain like a burning blaze.
Lord Woofington was given his title after the rest of the denizens of Havenswood succumbed to madness.
It has one solution to all of its problems: give em' a lashing.
Key activities include: rolling over, sunning self, whimpering for belly scratches, and enjoying belly scratches.
These whelps are frequently captured by the denizens of Jorundall when still young and trainable.
The crimson species of octopode grows larger and hardier than others, and is capable of sustaining crushing pressure in the depths.
It is an honor in the Sentinel Army to be entrusted with the care of an owl born from the boughs of the great tree Teldrassil.

Description_lang: The convenient part of robots that fight each other is that you can just put them back together. Step two is to attach a giant laser cannon to ensure you win the next battle.
Anyone serious about using a mechanical spider in battle knows that you need to buy replacement legs in bulk. Those things are fragile.
The Albatross is capable of flying further than any other species of bird on all of Azeroth.
Unlike most other bat species, the crimson bats are actually blind and rely entirely on echolocation to get around.
The feathers of the cobalt raven glow eerily in the moonlight, making them easy to spot during the night.
The Abyssal Eels are able to swallow and digest something up to twice the width of their body.
Mr. Crabs was victorious in a lengthy brawl amongst nearly a dozen other hermit crabs to claim his current shell.
Beakbert's favorite food is a ravenberry.
The skin of a teal frog sometimes shimmers just right in the sunlight, providing excellent camouflage when on the surface of the water.
Saurolisk scales are a surprisingly flexible but durable material that are often used to reinforce or mend things that are broken or worn through.
Quilen were the favored companions of the ancient Mogu race due to their loyal nature.
Crossing into the spirit world too often can be dangerous for your health.
The Engine of Nalak'sha is defended by many mighty beings, and many tiny beings.
For being an inanimate object for many centuries, this statue sure moves around really well.
This little cloud serpent's favorite activity is chasing its own tail.
The elemental spirits of Pandaria have been known to plan tricks to play on unsuspecting visitors years in advance.
Don't let these eat after midnight, legend has it that it's very dangerous.
The glow eminating from these is both calming and eerie at the same time when in total darkness.
The kunchong are extremely aggressive and will eat just about anything they can as soon as they are able to walk. If they can't eat it, they will smash it instead.
The mantid are extremely reliant upon amber for many things, and even use it in some of their magic.
As a spawn of the most dangerous sha, this little monster has some big plans, but needs to wait a few thousand years first.
This thing is equally as evil as it is adorable.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Achievement: |rRaiding with Leashes VI: Pets of Pandaria|n|cFFFFD200Category: |rCollect

Description_lang: This pocket-sized Lord of Blackrock is too small to call out any classes, but he can still dish up a good insult.
These dazzling hatchlings have a distinctive coat color that has been highly sought after by leatherworkers for generations.
Don't be fooled by Dottie's soft coat and big eyes, her tiny, sharp teeth are for more than just munching on grass.
Some argue that the beard is what grants a spell caster their power, but they're wrong. The hat is where the magic is really from.
The crabs of Nazjatar seem relatively unfazed by the sudden absence of the water.
The bright shells on these crabs makes them easy prey for predators, so they mostly stay to the shadows.
The bright shells of the hermit crabs of Nazjatar have the jewelry crafters of Azeroth buzzing with excitement.
The chitterspine make a distinctive clicking noise when they see prey in the open.
The "hissing" of this crab can be heard underwater, and is actually it rapidly clicking its smaller claws.
These albatrosses are slightly smaller than those found inland, and they can travel great distances over the sea.
The deep sea frenzies of Nazjatar have long been a staple food of the naga.
Some frenzies have been touched by whispers in the deep, and seek to turn the tides red with blood.
The pressure of the crushing depths at which these snails exist help to form its distinctive shell.
In the lightless trenches and chasms of the Great Sea, life still exists.
Of the many frightening things that lurk in the deeps, a chitterspine nest is really up there.
If you are diving into the deeps and one of these attaches itself to your leg, don't panic -- they're relatively harmless.
What else is there to say? Slugs love muck.
Snooters have a very good sense of smell and can easily find grass and seeds buried under snow or scrap.
The dark fur of the duskytooth allows them to more easily hide in the junkheaps of Mechagon Island.
Of all of the creatures in Mechagon, the roaches seem the most unaffected by all of the changes.
Experiments on this roach have grown it to an enormous size. Who would want that?
The frogs of Mechagon had two choices when faced with mechanization: hide or breed. This species chose the latter.
The frogs of Mechagon had two choices when faced with mechanization: hide or breed. This species chose the former.
The mechanical frogs of Mechagon Island have evolved to eat various mechanical insects, somehow.
The results of King Mechagon's experiments can be seen throughout the city and island.
Some of the few remaining fleshy creatures on Mechagon, they provide food and even companionship for the citizens of Rustbolt.
Experiments in mechanization have driven the few remaining critters in Mechagon to hide or flee.
Specimen 97 escaped from his cage before being fully mechanized. Now, he seeks revenge.
Though not real rats, they have taken over the back alleys of Mechagon City and carry diseased programs, earning them the name.
Natural burrowing tendencies were programmed into these critters, and now they perform vital functions breaking down the great piles of scrap.
When you need a hand, you know who to call.
The machinists of Mechagon may automate many of the tasks of the city, but they also spend a lot of time repairing and maintaining their inventions.
Doesn't remember what it was originally programmed to do, just wants to battle other pets.
A re-emergence of whelps outside of Grim Batol has the red dragonflight worried -- something is happening in the lost city.
The eels that inhabit the trenches and chasms of Nazjatar are a favored food of many creatures that inhabit the area.
Master of poking, stabbing, thrusting, jabbing, and gouging.
The murloc tribe that Murgle belongs to is one of few that have resisted the naga's enslavement.
Legend has it that the Necrofin tribe found necromancy on a series of runed tablets at the bottom of the sea.
Don't let the cuteness fool you, this little monster will jab your ankles the second you're not looking.
A rare species of crab found mostly in Nazjatar, it hides easily amongst the ample kelp and coral of the area.
Anything can be a nest, if you try hard enough.
When the sun shines on its shell just right, the light scatters in a thousand different directions.
A gift, found one day and saved for a meaningful occasion, should things ever turn around.
A gift, found one day and saved for a meaningful occasion, should things ever turn around.
A rare evolution of chitterspine, with elongated spines to pierce soft flesh and eyes.
As if a dark, underwater cave wasn't nightmarish enough, these things exist -- and they love it there.
These gruesome crabs are attracted to the scent of blood and seem to revel in combat.
In the lightless caverns, a bright shell color doesn't make you any worse at ambushing.
In a dark place unknown to all, the seabed writhes with the children of Nalaada, a carpet of life and death.
In the fathomless depths beyond the Eternal Palace, minds are lost in the blackness.
Frenzies in Nazjatar have learned to operate in large schools or face consumption by the many predators of the deeps.
The influence of the old gods on the aquatic life of Nazjatar is unmistakable, as many simply wander as mindless eyes of N'zoth.
Spireshells produce a softer shell when young which will be grown out of quickly.
Even with its softer juvenile shell, a young prismatic spireshell still glitters like a diamond.
The bright coloration of this deep water slug seems to give off a soft, warm glow.
Watch your ears.
The elements clash and battle for relics constantly, but few moreso than the Tidestone.
The Tidestone would empower minions of both the storm and the sea, and is sought after by both parties.
This pile of animated sand is fun to squish between your fingers, but doesn't really like it when you do that.
The hydra matriarchs of Nazjatar steal and destroy one another's eggs constantly, so you can never really know what will hatch out of one.
Standing next to a brinestone algan will remind you of the smell of the sea, mixed with rotting kelp.
There's no mistaking the evidence -- algan breed by budding. We can all put this argument to rest now.
The predatory coral of Nazjatar can grow incredibly quickly given the right conditions.
The eels of Nazjatar are experts at hiding in the many cracks and rocks of the sea floor.
When the waves crashed down around the city, not all were fortunate enough to receive N'zoth's gift.
The birth of an exceptionally rare Golden Snorf was such an abnormality that not even King Mechagon could force himself to mechanize his beloved, fuzzy friend.
Of all snooters, this one has the softest fur. Ironically, it does not like to be pet very much.
A rare snooter, and hard to find, it's known for burrowing itself deep under wet foliage to nest.
Many advancements have been made to the initial prototype homing beacon over the years.
It's not clear who the original owner of this arm was, but they're not getting it back now.
As handy as this invention is, it was also programmed to absolutely despise hand puns.
One of the microbots used to guard the city of Rustbolt, now purchasable for a reasonable price.
He's just so happy to be programmed to exist.
Absolutely do not let him bite your bones.
No one knows who made these mechanical spiders, but everyone hates them.
It doesn't take a very large ooze to eat a gnome.
The stench alone that this thing makes when it burps can easily ruin your day.
Every time the mandibles on this vibrate slightly, it is because it gave someone a nightmare.
Six legs, two claws, multiple eyes, spiked body? This thing has it all!
Dogs can hear her coming from extremely far away.
Even he cannot put out the fire in my heart.
Unkillable dragons, what could go wrong?
The last thing that tried to look in its tiny pack was never seen again.
In case of darkness, this little elemental is an infinite source of a soothing green glow.
The slimy coating on this otter provides excellent protection against sunburns.
Eels are already slimy. This one is extra slimy.
This little octopode squirts slime out instead of ink.
A fully grown Fangtooth has a bite strong enough to go right through a platinum fishing pole. Watch your fingers.
Living so deep within the seas has made this species very sensitive to lights.
The slime on this provides essential nutrients to the hermit crab within, allowing it to go years without eating anything if it chooses.
Slimy sea slugs secrete slimy sea slug slime on the slimy sea floor.
A walking vault that throws its money at you is not a very secure vault to own.
Burnout always has a supply of well toasted marshmallows.
Rikki has a talent for sneaking in and out of all manner of small spaces, if bribed properly with figs.
Little is known about the true intentions of this murloc, but her followers are among the most devoted.
An unlikely leader of murlocs that had to step into the role after the death of his father, Murgian.
Even the smallest creatures in the Shadowlands rely on anima to survive.
Daisy moves at a very leisurely pace, and will happily accept a ride on your shoulders.
Legend has it that these purple butterflies came from a place called Devil's Island.
The wings of this butterfly start off with no distinct color, but slowly change to yellow as they spend time in the sunlight.
This butterfly is stained red from the blood of its enemies.
This cat is known for her lies, ignore her sweet meows.
Pulled from a horrific vision of Orgrimmar these toads are soaked in void energy.
This pup is now more than just a bundle of fur and teeth, it is fur, teeth and void.
In Maldraxxus, plague has a strange habit of finding its way back to you.
The thirst for mana is insatiable, luckily this little one doesn't consume a whole lot.
N'Zoth's corruption spread across many beings, including this little Anubisath.
The aqir hive has countless numbers of beings in it, all of which are supportive of the ever-present Hivemind.
The winged aqir are very fast and agile, and their wings provide a nice breeze on a warm afternoon.
This creepy eye is looking at everyone, always, and only has to blink once every 10,000 years.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Treasure: |rVault of the Black Empire|n|cFFFFD200Zone: |rNy'alotha, the Waking City

Description_lang: It is very unclear whether this slime started with all of those eyes inside of it, or if those are "leftovers".
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Profession: |rFishing|n|cFFFFD200Zone: |rCorrupted Uldum or Vale of Eternal Blossoms

Description_lang: It is always C'Thuffer. Always.
Only a being of immense power could scar such an adorable creature, unless this hare was already approaching the darkness...
This cat eats anything from random scraps of food to strange glowing cubes of immense power. Be careful in front of its mouth.
A recent debate has risen up about whether Void-Scarred rats are better or worse than plagued rats.
This ooze leaves behind a slimy trail as it moves that has a stench that would rival a beast rotting in the dunes of Uldum for a thousand years.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Treasure: |rAlleria or Thrall's Corrupted Chest|n|cFFFFD200Zone: |rVision of Stormwind or Ogrimmar

Description_lang: The shell on these beetles is quite brittle from the void interference, but it also has a strangely fast regeneration rate.
This little guy grows an additional eye somewhere on its body every year. It rhymes with...
His tentacles give you the best hug your brain has ever felt.
Where did it come from, where does it go? Where did you come from, creepy tentacle?
Dragonbreath Chili is nothing compared to the stench coming from the mouth of this thing.
These Aqir Scarabs are masters at tunneling through any terrain.
These Pygmy Camels are often mistaken for Mysterious Camel Figurines.
This little guy was exiled and cursed by other watchers of Uldum to spend the rest of its time as a tiny insignificant being.
Three legs, two arms, three eyeballs, the extras are for emergency situations only.
Several adventurous miners have gone after the jade quilen in search of riches, but none have ever been heard from again.
Despite what the young pandaren may tell you, the windfeather cranes do not actually have feathers made out of wind.
Nobody is sure what sort of powder is coming off of these moths, and everyone is too terrified to find out what it actually is.
Even some of the insects have succumbed to the void. They really do adapt and survive through everything.
These look especially magnificent when gliding over the water under a full moon.
Is the void glow in addition to their natural glow, or does it replace it? The world may never know.
The golden chirper has managed to stay its pristine self, despite corruption attempts from both the Sha and from the forces of N'Zoth.
The name implies that there were 12 experiments done before this one that were less effective than sticking some guns onto a mechanical tiger. What could those have possibly been?
This bear's necessities are fresh batteries and an occasional oil change.
This lasher does not come from a black lagoon, or from the stars, or from beyond the moon. It just wants you to feed it.
Void magic and giant flying insects, a combination nobody ever asked for. Surprisingly effective!
If you received points for causing mischief while teleporting around as a tiny adorable vulpin, Renny would be on top of the leaderboard.
A wandering adventurer saved a small band of murlocs that had lost their homes, and a glimmer of hope was born.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Quest:|r Guardian of the Smallest|n|cFFFFD200Zone:|r Grizzly Hills|n

Description_lang: Inspired by the phalynx of Bastion, Engineers have modified the design to be approximately 300% more adorable.

All dogs go to Bastion. 

Cats go to Revendreth.
The crypts and tombs of Revendreth offer the perfect spider breeding ground, and Tomb Burster's brood has become fiercely territorial of their foothold.
Lightspawn can always be found on the battlefields where light touches, no matter what form it takes.
Beware awakening the power of knowledge.
A soul burdened with the sins of its past.
A soul, having faced the sins of the past, wanders lost in the recent turmoil of the Shadowlands.
The sludge that can give rise to the dredgers has been known to coalesce and run a muck.
Drawn from an overabundance of pride and wrath these manifestations seek even more to sustain themselves.
These creatures manifest in the catacombs beneath Revendreth due to vile rituals practiced on souls there.
The stone fiends were created to serve as messengers and spies for the realm of Revendreth, and those of the Court of Harvesters serve that role extremely well.
A fellow message courier to Chip, Dal was always on time until one day when he did not return from his appointed round.
Trapped in a chest and forgotten for years, this stone fiend is mad and looking for a fight.
This dredwing is the most common of the dredbats, seen throughout the entire realm.
A wild dredbat, the crimson pups are tough to tame. Their elusiveness and hardiness set them apart from their kin.
A rare mutation gives this dredbat its violet underbelly, making it a sought after gift for pet collectors with eclectic tastes.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Covenant Feature: |rThe Ember Court|n|cFFFFD200Covenant: |rVenthyr|n|n|cFFFFD200Covenant Feature: |rQueen's Conservatory|n|cFFFFD200Covenant: |rNight Fae|n|n|cFFFFD200Covenant Feature: |rPath of Ascension|n|cFFFFD200Covenant: |rKyrian|n|n|cFFFFD200Covenant Feature: |rAbomination Factory|n|cFFFFD200Covenant: |rNecrolord

Description_lang: Dodger is a bit small relative to other vulpin, but is excellent at playing hide and seek.
The claws of a vulpin sharpen themselves naturally when walking around on any sort of cobblestone or rocky surface.
Despite the adorable name, the chirp is more of a horrible, spine-tingling shriek.
These ferocious flying creatures scrape their beaks against hard surfaces to sharpen them and intimidate foes.
Floofa smells like citrus fruits when its fur is wet.
Much like how a squid can squirt ink to escape in the water, a glitterwing can shake the dust off of its wings and similarly vanish.
The moths of Ardenweald can carry seeds and pods many times their own weight, aiding the Night Fae in their eternal tasks.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Covenant Feature: |rThe Ember Court|n|cFFFFD200Covenant: |rVenthyr|n|n|cFFFFD200Covenant Feature: |rQueen's Conservatory|n|cFFFFD200Covenant: |rNight Fae|n|n|cFFFFD200Covenant Feature: |rPath of Ascension|n|cFFFFD200Covenant: |rKyrian|n|n|cFFFFD200Covenant Feature: |rAbomination Factory|n|cFFFFD200Covenant: |rNecrolord

Description_lang: Shimmermoths don't actually shimmer in the sunlight. Nobody knows who named these, but they have a lot to answer for.
When a full moon is visible, streaks of hair on the dreamfoal's mane start to shimmer and glow like shooting stars.
When the winds blow just right, howling through the canyons of Ardenweald, you can find these foals running with the wind in a spectacular show of prowess and color.
While these gormlings may not be the fastest diggers, they are very efficient and can move long distances underground before tiring.
Even the terrifying G'huun was, perhaps, once this cute.
These little slugs will try to eat literally anything they scoot over.
The sting from these gorm is incredibly painful and often inflicts temporary paralysis, even on large targets.
There are more sharp pointy things on this species of gorm than there are on a Horde capital city.
If you count the number of times its wings beat per minute, you can calculate how long it will be until this little terror will sting you.
No one knows where the devourers came from, but it is theorized that they flourish on several lost land masses in the In-Between.
The whooping noise these pets make when hungry will rival any tormented cry you can find in Torghast.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Covenant Feature: |rThe Ember Court|n|cFFFFD200Covenant: |rVenthyr|n|n|cFFFFD200Covenant Feature: |rQueen's Conservatory|n|cFFFFD200Covenant: |rNight Fae|n|n|cFFFFD200Covenant Feature: |rPath of Ascension|n|cFFFFD200Covenant: |rKyrian|n|n|cFFFFD200Covenant Feature: |rAbomination Factory|n|cFFFFD200Covenant: |rNecrolord

Description_lang: Part of the wildlife of Ardenweald, they sometimes sleep while standing straight up in the water.
A group of teroclaws is known as a fleece.
Young teroclaws are surprisingly effective hunters and will attempt to bring down prey up to twice their size.
For some reason, these blue glimmerflies are often afraid of water.
A glimmerfly can load up nearly fifty percent of its weight as pollen and still retain full agility while flying.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Quest:|r How to Catch a Glimmerfly|n|cFFFFD200Zone:|r Bastion

Description_lang: The wings of glimmerflies are almost always saturated with some sort of pollen, causing a very steady flow of glittery dust to fall off of them as they fly.
Contrary to popular belief, a terrapin's diet has nothing to do with its shell color.
These brightly-colored terrapins are the least commonly seen in the wild. It is considered a sign of luck if you rub the top of its shell.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Covenant Feature: |rThe Ember Court|n|cFFFFD200Covenant: |rVenthyr|n|n|cFFFFD200Covenant Feature: |rQueen's Conservatory|n|cFFFFD200Covenant: |rNight Fae|n|n|cFFFFD200Covenant Feature: |rPath of Ascension|n|cFFFFD200Covenant: |rKyrian|n|n|cFFFFD200Covenant Feature: |rAbomination Factory|n|cFFFFD200Covenant: |rNecrolord

Description_lang: Terrapins prefer any sort of berry as their primary source of food, though they will eat almost anything.
Vulpin actually have very light-colored skin, but their incredibly thick coats hide any color from showing through.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Covenant Feature: |rThe Ember Court|n|cFFFFD200Covenant: |rVenthyr|n|n|cFFFFD200Covenant Feature: |rQueen's Conservatory|n|cFFFFD200Covenant: |rNight Fae|n|n|cFFFFD200Covenant Feature: |rPath of Ascension|n|cFFFFD200Covenant: |rKyrian|n|n|cFFFFD200Covenant Feature: |rAbomination Factory|n|cFFFFD200Covenant: |rNecrolord

Description_lang: The golden vulpin are notorious for loud, barking yowls that echo across the plains of Bastion.
Despite having a very fine coat of fur, young vulpin do not shed at all.
How is a vulpin different than a fox? That is a good question.
Rarely, one of these kits is born to a golden-furred vulpin. It is considered a sign of distress in the pack.
These golden-feathered creatures do not lay golden eggs, for that you would need a golden goose.
If you mat their silvery feathers down very carefully, it almost forms a mirror-like surface.
When newly-hatched, they start with colorless, white feathers. Within weeks, they flourish into a wide spectrum of beautiful colors.
The mane on this tiny foal reflects a majestic indigo color when the light hits it in just the right way.
Few things are as adorable as a young skyfoal.
These flying creatures do not leave feathers out in the wild. If a feather happens to ever detach from their body, the feather glows brilliantly for a moment and then vanishes from sight.
The thrill of battle and the grip of war have not yet left the bones of Oonar.
A newborn bonetusk has no visible tusks, but within weeks their tusks grow to a size proportional to their body.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Covenant Feature: |rThe Ember Court|n|cFFFFD200Covenant: |rVenthyr|n|n|cFFFFD200Covenant Feature: |rQueen's Conservatory|n|cFFFFD200Covenant: |rNight Fae|n|n|cFFFFD200Covenant Feature: |rPath of Ascension|n|cFFFFD200Covenant: |rKyrian|n|n|cFFFFD200Covenant Feature: |rAbomination Factory|n|cFFFFD200Covenant: |rNecrolord

Description_lang: The tusks on these creatures are fused to their skulls in such a manner that they feel no pain when charging or ramming into anything.
The bright color of the luminous webspinner taunts would-be predators to chase them into their webs.
Maldraxxus is full of mighty and terrifying creatures, causing most denizens to be abnormally calm when around the indigenous species of giant spiders.
If this species spits venom at its prey, is it still technically considered venom, or just really gross?
That place on your back you can't quite scratch? Get the help of this little guy. Problem solved.
The bubbles inside of these ooze creatures make a very satisfying pop noise when they finally surface and rupture.
One of Plague Deviser Marileth's first creations, Shy Melvin was too timid for the demands placed on slimes by the House of Plagues.
A parasite that latches onto some of the larger beasts of Maldraxxus and drinks until fully-grown, one wonders how the beasts don't manage to notice.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Covenant Feature: |rThe Ember Court|n|cFFFFD200Covenant: |rVenthyr|n|n|cFFFFD200Covenant Feature: |rQueen's Conservatory|n|cFFFFD200Covenant: |rNight Fae|n|n|cFFFFD200Covenant Feature: |rPath of Ascension|n|cFFFFD200Covenant: |rKyrian|n|n|cFFFFD200Covenant Feature: |rAbomination Factory|n|cFFFFD200Covenant: |rNecrolord

Description_lang: Though they are quite squishy while young, the bloodlouse will eventually grow hardened plates around its entire body.
Being thrown into a pit of bloodlouse larvae is a painful fate for those that fail the great houses of Maldraxxus.
Some predators in Maldraxxus collect spines as trophies, and some of them don't stop moving even then.
What it lacks in appendages, it makes up for in positive attitude.
Even the smallest bones don't go to waste in Maldraxxus.
Is the ooze holding the bones in, or are the bones holding the ooze together?
It is not advisable to hug a sludge feeler. Those stains never wash out.
If you can beat them, stitch them!
The soul that occupies Mu'dud was a harsh ruler in life, and now he seeks to dominate the most violent kingdom of all.
The barbed mandibles on this species will dig deep into anything they bite, causing a lot of irritation.
Unlike most spiders that drain all the fluids from their prey, the bloodfeaster has developed a taste for blood alone.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Covenant Feature: |rThe Ember Court|n|cFFFFD200Covenant: |rVenthyr|n|n|cFFFFD200Covenant Feature: |rQueen's Conservatory|n|cFFFFD200Covenant: |rNight Fae|n|n|cFFFFD200Covenant Feature: |rPath of Ascension|n|cFFFFD200Covenant: |rKyrian|n|n|cFFFFD200Covenant Feature: |rAbomination Factory|n|cFFFFD200Covenant: |rNecrolord

Description_lang: Sometimes sins of great souls are so powerful that they animate the very stones they are placed on.
Dredgers are the sweat (and sometimes tears) of Revendreth, and their help is absolutely critical to the workings of Revendreth.
These dredbats are built by the Stonewright for the Court of Harvesters. They are bonded to their owners and become fierce fighters.
Identified by the signature coloring of their many legs, these spiders are known for elaborate dances used to threaten and confuse foes.
No longer lost, it's now considering a name change.
Roosting in the grounds of Castle Nathria, The Count did not foresee falling into an eternal stone slumber.
Joining with their new residents in Sinfall a few of these juvenile dredbats accompanied Renathal's forces into the maw.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Drop: |r Bastion Maw Assault|n|cFFFFD200Treasure: |rSinfall Screecher Cage|n|cFFFFD200Zone: |rThe Maw

Description_lang: Roosting over Sinfall, Battie was roused one evening by the music of the first Ember Court. She has not missed a single one since.
Abandoned by its master in a secluded room, the little bat has been hibernating in stone for ages.
