What vile subtance is jiggling around inside of this creature?
Hiding among the reeds near muck pools, juvenile mire creepers patiently waiting for easy prey to approach.
Subsisting on the residual anima in the waste of the Endmire, these mire creepers are withering away, yet in their famished state they are doubly dangerous.
This particular tiny tree is infested with strange spores and doesn't seem to mind.
These saplings grow unnaturally quickly when given enough anima, and their leaves are razor sharp when fully grown.
As long as any fragment of this species is found and planted, it will regrow into the same magnificent species as it once was.
Whatever you do, don't ask it to carry a bucket of water. We don't talk about what happened to that area of the Shadowlands.
This pet has tremendous airborne agility and will always land on its feet, even when flung by a home-made spring-loaded leaper-flinger.
The latent energy found throughout Ardenweald's seeds sometimes augments small critters with unnatural abilities.
These critters are capable of holding a tremendous amount of food in their cheeks for easy transportation between hiding spaces.
No one is quite sure where Reginald got his or her name, but what we do know is they don't answer to anything else.
The skies may have scorched part of Revendreth, but persistent creatures are still able to exist in these harsh conditions.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Drop:|r Ashen Amalgamation|n|cFFFFD200Covenant Feature:|r Ember Court|n|cFFFFD200Covenant:|r Venthyr|n|cFFFFD200Zone:|r Revendreth

Description_lang: Nobody knows why all of these skeletal hands are from the left hand. Where did the right hands go?
Torghast is a tower of hardship and perpetual agony, which is a perfect environment for these creatures.
Many have asked where these creatures came from, and how they made it to the Maw, but none that researched them have ever been heard from again.
If a detached hand claps by itself inside of Torghast, can the Jailer hear it?
The mysterious forces that animate this mobile mitt don't seem particularly evil, yet.
Sometimes it is best to leave what strange creature you found in a mysterious jar in the depths of Torghast alone.
Its teeth are razor sharp and will chew through just about anything.
These guardians of Torghast are always watching for suspicious activity.
That eerie feeling you get when the shadows seem to shift and follow you isn't just a feeling, it's usually one of these.
Poking a tiny gormlng in the side makes a very satisfying, squishy noise. It is NOT advisable to poke one too many times.
Remornia has been exposed to untold amounts of evil and sin, and will siphon power from any available source to fuel its desires.
Staring at one of these creates a deep void of emotion at the very core of your being, then fills it with a sense of dread.
This species has a very distinct set of markings on its back that makes it easy to identify in the unending horrors of the Maw.
Tiny flakes of skin seem to perpetually fall off of this horrible creature, leaving behind a trail and a very distinct, foul odor.
The razor sharp claws will tear into anything with ease, making for an excellent emergency can opener.
What horrors these eyes have seen in the tower of Torghast, with their unsleeping, unblinking gaze?
Plucking a feather from a steward is considered a sin worthy of a trip to Revendreth.
Though not very fuzzy, this slimy feline is still one of the most adorable things you've ever seen.
While young, they have an adorable face and cute little antennae. While grown up, they gain razor sharp pinchers and are unstoppable eating machines. Life is full of compromises.
This slime seems to change color the more you look at it, and then suddenly, it appears to be looking back at you. Perhaps it is time for a rest.
Despite being decrepit and undead, geists move with exceptional speed and agility.
You got spinebugged!
Normally just a plain white in color, their skin reflects whatever they have eaten and gains wonderful spots of color depending on the organs digested.
Legends say that if you see a bleak skitterer in your dreams, you are destined to battle one to the death.
These slimy creatures make the strangest suction noises when they try to climb up a wall. This is a well-known fact in Maldraxxus, for obvious reasons.
Toxic spores rain down wherever these creatures fly, turning small, unwary critters into a gruesome feast.
A strange whelp hatched on Netherwing Ledge, it is thought to be blessed by the waning lunar energies of Shadowmoon Valley.
A good friend to Archivist Fane since his earliest days, Janeera is ready for him to let the quill go as she feels he is getting too attached.
Stewards looking to move up in steward society know to fluff up their feathers, give out tons of juice, and always be hooting.
Tales say that the stewards were created to aid the denizens of Bastion in their eternal duties. They don't seem to mind.
Larion are prideful beasts, and see anyone that enters their territory as a challenge.
When fully-grown, a larion that has grown up with an aspirant will never leave his or her master's side.
Young larions are often given to aspirants as an early test of compassion and leadership.
Lucy was sent to Revendreth, as all cats are, and somehow escaped. When questioned, local dredgers blamed it on her being a cat.
Spriggans are tricky foes that live in Ardenweald and torment the Night Fae. This one has decided to play the ultimate trick--joining you.
The allegiances of the spriggan are as changing as the seasons.
Raised in the verdant groves of Ardenweald, these kits are infused with the essence of rebirth.
These grubs consume anima-depleted materials of all types. They aren't picky.
The wings of this moth glitter like the starry skies above Ardenweald.
For a pet that's all mouth, where does anything it eats go? Maldraxxus necromancers have dissected many of these pets, and have no answers.
Squibbles is engineered to never leave your side.
Baubleworms are highly prized in the Veiled Market, where those featuring few gemstone flaws can fetch extreme prices.
The fields of battle teem with Lil'Abom parts, which are perfectly interchangable and easy to put back together.
Infused etherwyrms can be used as portable anima batteries, but they must be trained not to flee at the sight of combat.
Dragons come in all types of temporal classification -- timeless, time-lost, and even infinite.
Sly snuck aboard for a trip into the Maw. He's not scared, he just really wants to stay in your backpack for a while.
A young animite will rapidly grow if fed in excess. It is suggested that no more than one average soul's worth of anima be consumed per year to keep them docile.
The brilliant scales of the etherwyrm reflect the bright skies of Bastion.
The gemstones on a baubleworm will quickly deteriorate if the worm is killed. Healthy worms are kept as prized pets by wealthy Brokers.
Baubleworms were found by the Brokers on an unknown world, and so gorgeous were their gems, that quickly the expedition turned against one another.
Baubleworms have no natural predators, and grow their gemstones to attract mates.
New species of murloc are discovered around Azeroth all the time, owing to their invasive nature and varied diet.
The Purrkin hunt the invasive skrats in the Veiled Market, keeping the population just high enough that they are still needed.
Purrkins are a traditional pet of the Brokers and the two have a mutually beneficial relationship -- a necessity in Broker culture.
Gizmo is considered a perfect purrkin, perhaps the best that has ever existed. He is also a ruthless murderer of small critters.
Skrats are poisonous, venomous, and unusually damp -- everything you want in a pet.
Skrats are an especially invasive species, in that they can reproduce with only a sole skrat, and consume almost anything.
One particular Broker has taken a liking to the skrat species, kept this rare specimin as a pet, and inherited the smell as a souvenir.
When you're a Maldraxxian stitchcrafter and you have to name a lot of abominations, sometimes you just go with the obvious choice.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Drop:|r War Chest of the Undying Army|n|cFFFFD200Zone:|r The Maw|n

Description_lang: Not quite alive, not quite dead, simply an arm, with no head.
Gorm find a way to invade just about anywhere, and the Maw is no exception.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Drop:|r War Chest of the Wild Hunt|n|cFFFFD200Zone:|r The Maw

Description_lang: Though the spawn of a gorm queen lost within the Maw, this pet appears to be untainted by the Jailer's foul magics.
The nails of the mawrat can inflict one of several afterlife-ending illnesses.
Fragments of souls abound in the Maw, searching for meaning, or an end to their torment. But some just want to give you a hand.
These ensorcelled gauntlets are used by the mawsworn to capture escaping prisoners.
Struggle all you want, it will just grip harder.
There was once a mawsworn so vile that he was killed by his own minions. So great was his malice that a fragment of him lives on in this glove.
A species of wild pest that exists within the Maw, no one is quite sure what it eats or why it exists, but they can't get rid of it.
Every deathroach is technically considered vile, but these really take the cake.
See reflections on the water? There's more than darkness in the depths.
These eyes were sent to slow and debilitate the wayward souls of the Maw, so that they could be more easily captured.
One of several indistinguishable pets, all named Chompy.
The Eye of the Jailer, diffused, is now merely an all-seeing magical bauble.
The rage Zovaal harbored for his punished existence echoes through the eye.
The golden armor on these mawsworn is flimsy and easily bent -- the gilded armor is a punishment.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Drop:|r Adamant Vaults|n|cFFFFD200Zone:|r Torghast, Tower of the Damned|n

Description_lang: The Sanctum of Domination accepts mawsworn of all shapes, sizes, and levels of corporeality.
A ruthless tormenter of the smallest souls. Some say he was known in life as "Thermaplugg."
Rook never speaks, and little about them is known.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Drop:|r Mysterious Gift from Ve'nari|n|cFFFFD200Zone:|r The Maw

Description_lang: You have never met a pet that is more about chewing.
The garnetgullet rolls in bright red flowers to enhance its color, serving as a call to similar species and a warning to enemies.
With Korthia torn asunder by the Jailer, the few species that remain must be archived.
The hide color of this species is more rare on Korthia, and helps it hide from predators. And mawsworn, in this case.
A domesticated species, it is quite calm and seems hungry.
Devourers exist throughout the In-Between of various types and levels of power, but always seeking anima.
It only has two teeth, and they both mean business.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Drop:|r Supplies of the Archivists' Codex|n|cFFFFD200Zone:|r Korthia

Description_lang: Corpsefly eggs end up everywhere in Maldraxxus, and are easily transported accidentally.
Blinky just hatched, and is ready for adventure, but may need a few naps along the way.
One part focus, one part core, zero parts coherent or stable shape.
The core of a song that all but faded long ago.
It could become anything. It could become *everything*. In the meantime, it's... this.
It's hard to be sure since it has no face, but this thing seems to like you.
The signature song of the bufonid croaker can be heard across vast distances.
One part facial sphere, one part cube manufactory, one part successful curiosity.
Hatch-queen of the baby murlocs, Murkastrasza spent many years battling her bitter rival, Deathy.
Only newly synthesized tunneling vombata have been seen. The rest are probably happily digging underground, never to be seen again.
A drakonid hatchling is a curious sight, but now is the time for curious things.
One part beak, two parts wings, one part inability to stop, one part unwillingness to stop.
One part rocks, two parts bigger rocks, three parts smaller rocks, one part ability to move anyway.
Some of the more adventurous denizens of Zereth Mortis consider venomous bufonids to be a delicacy.
One part slippery skin, one part powerful legs, one part vocal sac, one part complete self-acceptance.
One part duplication, two parts duplication, four parts duplication... oops.
Some leporids are docile and cute. Others are... still cute.
Some of the more timid leporids live deep underground. They emerge only to gather food before returning to their burrows.
While larger proto avians are known to feed on small animals, fledglings mostly eat insects and grubs.
One part gills, one part haste, one part whatever it needs to be.
The distinctive red coloration of scarlet proto avians makes it difficult for them to hide from predators, which ironically means they're very hard to find.
Eight parts legs. Eight parts eyes. One part rope. One part insatiable hunger.
Some tarachnids prefer to lie in wait for their prey. These prefer to chase it, disable it, and devour it whole.
When prey wanders into this creature's reach, it rarely wanders out.
One part shell. One part claw. As many parts resilience as need be.
Some of the smaller scarabids of Zereth Mortis have metallic outer shells to protect themselves. It also makes them look fabulous.
This scarabid's brightly colored shell makes it more interesting to potential mates. Unfortunately, this also makes them interesting to potential predators.
Three parts planning, one part danger, one part noodle.
The distinctive red coloration of these viperids serves as a warning to potential predators: 'eat at your own risk!'
Where does a 350-pound viperid sit? Anywhere it wants.
Viperids can sit still for hours, silently awaiting their prey.
Two parts wings, one part dagger, five parts sadism.
Whether in life or the afterlife, some things are universal. Nasty blood-sucking insects are one of those things.
Despite its vulnerable appearance, predators will often avoid attacking a juvenile vombata. It's not known exactly why, but many believe it has to do with the vombata's cute little nose.
There are many terrifying things in Zereth Mortis, but none so terrifying (or adorable) as a vombata protecting its young.
No one in their right mind has ever seen a Mawtouched Geomental. Even so, plenty of people have seen Mawtouched Geomentals.
The ambystan snapper is one of the nicest creatures you can meet in Zereth Mortis... until it isn't.
Most of Zereth Mortis' aurelids are content to swim, but some are born to fly!
Nobody calls this poultrid 'chicken.'
When confronted, helicids will hide in their heavily armored shells. If provoked further, they will lash out with devastating force.
Two parts wings, one part beak, two parts talon, one part smugness.
This tiny tormentor of Torghast relishes in punishing any soul in the tower that can't step on it.
Isn't she just the sweetest little helicid?
Ambystans are swift but cowardly creatures. At the first hint of danger, a darter will hide in the nearest hole.
The red coloring on this scarabid lets potential opponents know it is not to be trifled with.
These poultrids are hostile, but never angry. They love every moment of every battle.
It's really unclear what's 'multi' about them.
Lihuvim's geomental creations are the most majestic of walking rock piles.
Just one part jelly, but refreshed over and over and over again.
It feeds on fear, but is generally too cute to inspire terror on its own.
This creature's existence strongly implies the existence of other, more advanced tickle-based aurelids out there.
Left to their own devices, these leporids will leap high into the air at the slightest provocation. Sometimes they'll even come down properly, as well.
Two parts fortress, one part eyestalks, one part slime.
Where some viperids lie in wait for their prey, this variety stalks their intended meals for hours.
Since synthesized creatures come into being fully grown, why would anyone design an immature helicid?
Spunky, funky, and just a little clunky -- she's a Gnomish engineer to a T!
A little ambystan that was too big, then too little, and finally just right. He followed you home!
Looks like Ben'jin and Maka'fon have kept busy since you last saw them. Maka'jin is ready for adventure but will settle for a large pile of leafy greens.
He has a heart of gold. Literally. These shiny good-boys are all the rage with affluent gnomes everywhere.
Fooled aeons ago by the clever loa of death into a bargain of unceasing service, this tiny ancient being carries out his duties eternally red with rage.

This isn't the real Pocopoc, but it provided this replica to you for use outside Zereth Mortis. Its details are so accurate as to be utterly convincing to anyone who hasn't spent lots of time with the real one.
Ichabod began his existence as a prototype for the fearsome harvest golems terrorizing the farmers of Westfall, but a little gnomish ingenuity has since made him far less likely to attack your knees.
Before he was known as one of the Wild Gods, Ursoc roamed the Grizzly Hills as a cub.
Some hawkstriders are destined to be great. Others are destined to be Egbob.
Some species of red bees are known to lead solitary lives. Still, this busy bee seems happy to make time for you.
Ancient Gorian blood runs through Garrlok's veins. As far as anyone knows, only his diminutive stature keeps his imperial ambitions in check.
Siege training begins early for kodo calflings that show a lack of inhibition towards breaking things. Mind your shins.
To its foes, this Watcher's innocent eyes belie the lethal danger of a prowling Huntress, waiting in the shadows.
His pink antlers make him the life of any party.
The master jewelcrafters of the Dragon Isles have perfected their craft so much that their gemmed statues can be brought to life. This whelp forged of obsidian is now not to be trifled with.
This little rabbit is cute from the tip of her button nose to the tips of her deadly claws.
Nearly invisible, this creature leaps from tree to snow-covered tree.
Hope, like this phoenix, rises from the ashes of shattered dreams.

Some very clever wizard or dragon or other magical being thought they were being clever when they decided to color an ice elemental purple for a very elaborate bit of wordplay. They were probably right.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Achievement:|r What Can I Say? They Love Me.|n

Description_lang: It looks like a duck and it smells like a duck and it quacks like a duck... what's a duck?
A shard of a fragment of a piece of a sliver of a piece of crystal, but walking around like it owns the place. Good thing it likes you.
Truly, the most dignified of stinky musken.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Achievement:|r Good Things Come in Small Packages

Description_lang: Above the vast green plains and rolling hills the slyvern fly, leaving only tiny shadows on the ground to mark their path through the sky.
You met this Slyvern next week from your point of view, but last year from its point of view.
Oddly enough, you met this fish drifting through the air.
To some, this fish speaks eloquently of its survival in the most arduous conditions. To most, it says 'glub.'
This is the most pettable pointy creature you will ever meet.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Pet Battle: |rOhn'ahran Plains, Thaldraszus, The Azure Span, The Waking Shores

Description_lang: Somehow this creature manages to be hot, rocky, and slimy all at the same time.
When Alvin said he wanted to be the best anvil ever, everyone doubted him. If anvils could laugh, he'd be the one laughing now.
Chestnut once found an acorn larger than he was, ate the whole thing, and doubled in size. It's a good thing he didn't eat a Trunkalumpf.
Many have tried to boop the cute little noses of creatures like this. Most have lost fingers.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Pet Battle: |rOhn'ahran Plains, Thaldraszus, The Azure Span

Description_lang: It's been a busy three years for this litte critter. It was born next year, rased last year, and adopted as your pet this year.
Pistachio got her name in exactly the way you would expect.
This little racing enthusiast has never missed a race and has never met a racer she didn't like.
These elusive creatures are famous for being hard to find unless you already know where to look. Fortunately, Haniko told you where to look.
Between battling, bathing, and playing, these ottuks have very busy schedules.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Pet Battle: |rOhn'ahran Plains, The Azure Span, The Waking Shores

Description_lang: The reverberating sound of an adult hornswog's belch can be heard for leagues. Less far-reaching, but far more musical, is the dainty sound of a swoglet belching.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Pet Battle: |rOhn'ahran Plains, Thaldraszus, The Azure Span, The Waking Shores

Description_lang: When you feel a chill run down your spine, don't be afraid. It's probably just your pet snowlemental.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Pet Battle: |rThe Azure Span, The Waking Shores

Description_lang: Baby ottuks spend their days swimming, chasing butterflies, and practicing their intimidating roars.
In its big eyes you can see your own reflection. You also see everything else because its eyes are so big.
His name is Mister Toots because of the melodious sounds he can make with his trunk.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Quest: |rSo How Did It Go?|n|cFFFFD200Zone: |rThe Waking Shores

Description_lang: A dream of the memory of fire.
While their tiny tusks may not help much in a fight, the trunkalumpfs make up for it in sheer weight.
A spark can become an ember. An ember can become a raging fire. This creature was never a spark or an ember, it has only ever been a raging fire.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Drop:|r World Drop|n|cFFFFD200Weather:|r Elemental Storm (Fire)|n|cFFFFD200Zone:|r The Waking Shores, Ohn'ahran Plains, The Azure Span, Thaldraszus

Description_lang: It sits anywhere it wants to, but it prefers to sit on laps.
Scruffles' lust for battle runs deep.
Some think this creature is smoldering because it is on fire. In truth it's because of its burning gaze.
Red for the fires in which it was born.
Is it possible to rise from the ashes of time? Gerald thinks so and he will not be denied.
An Igneoid is formed when magma makes it to Azeroth's surface and is infused with dark elemental magic. The resulting creature is tiny, fierce, and very cute.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Pet Battle: |rThaldraszus, The Azure Span, The Waking Shores

Description_lang: This salamanther wants to be your best friend.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Pet Battle: |rOhn'ahran Plains, Thaldraszus, The Azure Span, The Waking Shores

Description_lang: This Salamanther met itself while lost in time. The two hung out on a rock together for a few hours. It was nice.
Many salamanthers have interesting colorations, but this salamanther has the coolest one.
What the deep claims, none can reclaim.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Drop:|r World Drop|n|cFFFFD200Weather:|r Elemental Storm (Water)|n|cFFFFD200Zone:|r The Waking Shores, Ohn'ahran Plains, The Azure Span, Thaldraszus

Description_lang: Though many creatures of the Dragon Isles are mysterious, the ducks are perhaps the most so. Where did they come from? Where are they going? What are they planning? We may never know.
Quack.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Pet Battle: |rOhn'ahran Plains, Thaldraszus, The Waking Shores

Description_lang: Still learning how to fly.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Quest: |rBut... I Am the Hero of Ducks|n|cFFFFD200Zone: |rOhn'ahran Plains

Description_lang: What do you feed a cute little duckling? What? No, not cheese and quackers! Quackers aren't healthy for ducks.
Beep. Beep. Beep. Quack.
This is the terror that flaps o'er the Dragon Isles. This is the winged nightmare that pecks at your emerald dreams. What? No it's not Deathwing, it's a duck!
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Pet Battle: |rOhn'ahran Plains, The Waking Shores, Valdrakken

Description_lang: As small as it is, it's no wonder this little duckling got lost in time.
These beautiful, elusive birds have very erratic migratory patterns, which can be difficult to track, leading some explorers to erroneously believe ducks simply didn't exist.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Treasure:|r Slightly Chewed Duck Egg|n|cFFFFD200Zone:|r Ohn'ahran Plains|n

Description_lang: In the mountain air, frost lingers upon the grass as a storm rolls in.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Drop:|r World Drop|n|cFFFFD200Weather:|r Elemental Storm (Air)|n|cFFFFD200Zone:|r The Waking Shores, Ohn'ahran Plains, The Azure Span, Thaldraszus

Description_lang: Its eyes can see the flick of a mouse tail from leagues away.
If a duck quacks in the woods and nobody is around to hear it, does it even exist?
Each of this creature's steps shakes the ground. When enough of them run together it sounds like a raging thunderstorm.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Pet Battle: |rOhn'ahran Plains, Thaldraszus, The Waking Shores

Description_lang: Contrary to its name, this little creature shakes nothing as it shuffles from place to place.
Who's the cutest little monster? You are!
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Quest:|r Oh Where, Oh Where Can He Be?|n|cFFFFD200Zone:|r Thaldraszus

Description_lang: Though it's rare, thunder lizards have been known to bond with centaurs. And their close allies. Lucky you!
When these creatures stampede, they sound like a thunderstorm. When these creatures stampede in a thunderstorm, they sound like a cataclysm.
Soon after you put down this slyvern's decay-twisted mother, you learned the hard way both how it got its name and why Zon'Wogi asked you to care for it.
These critters' white coats help them hide in the snow when  predators are around.
There is no fury quite like that of a mother Blackfeather defending her nest.

These birds use their sharp beaks and dragon-like talons to forage for prey on tree trunks and branches. They communicate with each other by drumming on the trees with their beaks, which makes a sound that can be heard over great distances.
It has bright feathers. What else is there to say?
Faithful and ferocious, this bakar is a hero's best friend.
When not lazily floating down a river, this Timbertooth is fond of snacks and snuggles.
Hunters value these critters more for their companionship than their pelts.
As good as gold and better. These little guys are quite frail but exceedingly brave. - Bob Bigheart
A timbertooth with lighting inside? Shocking!
Gnawing at the roots of magic trees have given this creature the ability to transcend time itself.
Is it normal for a fish to have fangs?
This frillfish is a no-frills kind of frillfish.
The vorquin of the dragon isles have manes that come in a variety of stunning colors.
It's quite possible this creature is aging backwards. It looks a bit younger every time you see it.
Behold! A pale vorquin.
It will probably grow bigger. Probably.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Pet Battle: |rThaldraszus, The Azure Span, The Waking Shores

Description_lang: Sharp crystal needles protrude from this creature's back, and yet it still wants you to pet it somehow.
This little dragon is all fired up! It looks like he's got some things to do.
Sometimes you can see blue light flickering deep inside the gems that make up this strange creature.
The hardest part to shape was the whelpling's cute little snout.
Trade Prince Gallywix wants you to know that he already owns three of these.
A magically infused emerald sits at the heart of this creature.
Raindrops whip around this creature with frightening speed, ripping and tearing anything that touches it. Experts say the best way to avoid injury is to give it a treat and some snuggles.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Quest:|r A Primal Threat|n|cFFFFD200Zone:|r The Dranosh'ar Blockade (Horde), Stormwind Harbor (Alliance)|n

Description_lang: A brilliant executive assistant and apprentice, Lord Basilton also loves to stick his nose into piles of anything interesting.
These small bears will not normally attack people, but they have been known to steal the occasional picnic basket.
It's not easy having red fur during the winter, but in the autumn it's very fashionable.
These creatures' shells are not literally made of stone, but they're strong enough that they might as well be.
A playful splash from this otter will give you quite a shock.
Formed by the reckless use of elemental magic, the slumbering earth awakens. It is angry.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Drop:|r World Drop|n|cFFFFD200Weather:|r Elemental Storm (Earth)|n|cFFFFD200Zone:|r The Waking Shores, Ohn'ahran Plains, The Azure Span, Thaldraszus

Description_lang: Despite its name, its shell is actually much tougher than chalk.
These creatures are highly sought after by hunters looking to make weapons from the sharp crystals on its back.
The blood of a crimsonspine flows through the clear crystal structures that make up its body, which causes its unique coloration.
An adult Snowclaw can rattle the very trees with its roar. A cub can rattle one of the smaller branches.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200World Event:|r Primal Bear Cub|n|cFFFFD200Zone:|r Azure Span

Description_lang: This turtle eats bugs, as you'd expect from its name, but you wouldn't believe how large the bugs are.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200World Event:|r A Small Favor for Cymre Brightblade|n|cFFFFD200Zone:|r Waking Shores|n

Description_lang: Exposure to magic, minerals, and water pressure has left this crab looking very sharp.
These crabs build their own shells from small fragments of rocks and gems.
Oooh, shiny!
These creatures were bred to hunt snakes. With a low profile and a long body, Snakebiters are perfect for chasing serpents into their own holes.
Most brightly colored frogs are incredibly poisonous. The Roseate Hoppers are different because they are only credibly poisonous.
A troublesome mage named McGwire decided to start a small fire. He summoned a flame which caused him to exclaim: 'This is much more alive than required!'
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Pet Battle: |rThaldraszus, The Azure Span, The Waking Shores

Description_lang: The core temperature of an Emberling is hot enough to dissolve anything organic, so make sure to wear gloves if you want to pet it.
Ironically, she has a warm personality.
Born of living stone. Reforged by the hands of Wrathion's agents. Sadly much too tiny to make a difference in the black dragons' war against the djaradin.
It's tried to cut down, but magic is just so tasty.
This proto-whelp's distinctive coloration is highly prized by pet trainers.
After pestering the Dragonscale Basecamp for weeks, Granpap Whiskers discovered a way to catch them and use them to get rid of other more annoying insects.
Under the invitation and tutelage of Doc Nanners many Gray Marmoni have become common, but not always desired guests at the Dragonscale Expedition Basecamp.
As an egg, this proto-drake was struck by a freak bolt of lightning. Years later, the lightning still lives inside.
Peck. Peck. Zap!
This what your mother always warned you would happen if you ate grass that was struck by lightning.
This is not your grandfather's duck! Or.. maybe it is?
A small fraction of the titans' power, an even smaller fraction of their size.
Affectionate and curious, these kittens seem to find the most peculiar hiding places.
The bad news is that these bugs are carnivorous. The good news is that they usually just eat other bugs.
These critters often leave their spawning groups as soon as they can move around on land.
The greatest souvenir available in a dragon's spa in the clouds. Not so good at facials any more, though.
Though she may be fashionably late, Lady Feathersworth will always show up for a party.
Scout came to the Dragon Isles for adventure and excitement. After finding you, he got both.
When the Bushbeard clan decided they were going to have a wedding, they chose Petal to be the flower girl. She was spectacular.
I wish that I could bind the tides and bend them to my will. But in its depths the sea abides and waits for no one still.
When it was captured and bound to a cage made of enchanted metal, this spirit managed to twist and reshape the metal into the suit of armor it now wears.
This is the soul of a forest fire. Though its armor keeps its flames under control, you sometimes notice it gazing longingly at dead trees and dry underbrush.
When it was the wind, this spirit carried scents to every corner of Azeroth. Sometimes you can still smell on it the barest hint of food, smoke, or the carnage of battle.
After finding a clutch of black proto-whelps, Wrathion took them under his wing.
Cubbly's extended proximity to time magic has given him powers far beyond the average bear.
Do you dare to open this book of draconic secrets?
With her distinctive coloration and impeccable work ethic, Pinkie has propelled herself to the top of the tallstrider fashion world.
This creature is usually known to be quite docile, but try to stick a carrot in its face and YOU WILL lose feeling in your fingers.
Arrogant from a past life in the stormy Forbidden Reach, pines after the good old days when the elements controlled the land. Bit of a blow hard really.
Claims to be from a long lost land from the remnants of a massive volcano, but that story seems a little shaky.
The flames surrounding it burn more intensely during combat. Could even say that pet battles get it stoked.
Perks its head up when hearing conversation as it likes to stay current on world affairs.
Who needs a toolbelt when a handy robot can follow you around! Just don't bump into it too hard.
An old and dangerous discarded toy.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Treasure:|r Tattered Gift Package|n|cFFFFD200NPC:|r Prototype Tinker-Tron|n|cFFFFD200Zone:|r Zskera Vaults, The Forbidden Reach|n

Description_lang: Puddlehoppers are known to eat bugs almost as large as they are. In one gulp!
Rock martins make their nests out of scavenged pebbles.
When these insects move in a swarm they look like a golden fog.
This creature usually has a muddy appearance, but occasionally you may find one that shines a brilliant red.
The bright glow of a stonewhisker's ears is said to be the result of eating magical cheeses. This may also explain its extremely bad breath.
Slimy, yet also gritty. It would not make a good meal.
Boulderfangs are known to make cozy nests in cabinets, shoes, and other inconvenient places.
Despite being made mostly of rock, these creatures can fly. Some attribute this to the strength of their wings, but most agree it's probably just magic.
Not all moths spin silk. These moths spin lies.
The call of the lithengale is unique among birds in that it has a persistent, driving rhythm.
Because their dens tend to be close to drogbar settlements, these snails are both faster and stronger than those on the surface.
The fire at the center of the world burns within its carapace.
A tiny sun seems to burn in its chest.
Because they are often attracted to candles, these moths can be a big problem for kobolds.
There must always be a Lick King.

If Roland has taught you anything, it's that friendship comes at a price.

That price is lots and lots of cheese.
Like a campfire, but it wants skritches.
Nothing sparked joy in Ambre's heart until it found the perfect match.
Other frogs like to play, but this one is feeling too blue.
Being green is... not easy.
Annuna's distinctive coloration is due to her eating nothing but orange dragonflies.
Crimson swoglets are considered the most scholarly of all swoglets because they're well red.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Vendor: |rCelestine of the Harvest|n|cFFFFD200Zone: |rThe Waking Shores|n|cFFFFD200Zone: |rOhn'ahran Plains|n|cFFFFD200Zone: |rThe Azure Span|n|cFFFFD200Zone: |rThaldraszus|n|cFFFFD200Cost: |r250|Hitem:207026|h|TInterface\ICONS\INV_Enchant_DustStrange.blp:0|t|h

Description_lang: Three years ago this swoglet was a fully grown adult.
Named after her favorite food.
Its insides are a raging inferno. Its outside is happy pup.
Imagine the size of the birds that eat these bugs.
Lord Stantley will arrive fashionably early to any party that serves shrimp.
It's not really all that savage, just a little crabby.
It got its name because its favorite food is fondue.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Vendor: |rCelestine of the Harvest|n|cFFFFD200Zone: |rThe Waking Shores|n|cFFFFD200Zone: |rOhn'ahran Plains|n|cFFFFD200Zone: |rThe Azure Span|n|cFFFFD200Zone: |rThaldraszus|n|cFFFFD200Cost: |r250|Hitem:207026|h|TInterface\ICONS\INV_Enchant_DustStrange.blp:0|t|h

Description_lang: Fortunately it mainly devours pet treats.
A warlock won this little guy at an infernal carnival, but it quickly outgrew its aquarium.
Like Neltharion, this fish went mad listening to whispers of the Old Cods.
How exactly does one swim through a void? This creature knows, but isn't telling.
This type of beetle feeds on dragon scales. Its bright coloration warns predators against attack.
If bananas grew in caves, they would be Rango's favorite food.
Miloh likes naps. Also snacks.
Rusty's powerful nose could smell a needle in a haystack.
Amador has a big heart and loves to help people, especially children and elders. He also likes belly rubs.
Sure it's just a rock, but how much can it lift?
Jerrie was once an ordinary rock mouse. He still is, in fact.
These snails are especially prized by many drogbar snail-racers for being fast and looking fantastic.
While not as fast as some of the other snails in the Zaralek Cavern, Bashful makes up for it with sheer power.
Known to hide money in its shell.
Layers of rocky skin make Ambershells very tough to hurt.
Roseshells are known to be very agressive, but aren't very fast. So if you mess with one, prepare to be bitten in about five seconds.
Somehow pretty and gross at the same time.
For a creature made of rocks it hovers quite effortlessly.
These pests are known for their cantankerous attitudes and affinity for nesting in the smokestacks of Undermine, much to the locals dismay.
This creature can eat twice its bodyweight at a single meal.
It doesn't even bother to chew its food.
Perhaps you'd like to see how snakelike it can be!
Skaarn likes to coil up inside of your backpack.
He doesn't want you to know this, but Mikah's favorite food is broccoli.
The fury of the sea in the packge of a puddle.

Whereas some moths are attracted to light, this particular moth seems attracted to warm, fuzzy feelings. Some say the phrase "butterflies in your stomach" actually refers to an infestation of Heartseeker Moths.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200World Event:|r Love is in the Air|n|cFFFFD200Cost: |r40 |Hitem:49927|h|TInterface\ICONS\INV_ValentinesCard01.BLP:0|t|h

Description_lang: Undermoths are known to be some of the most intelligent moths on Azeroth. This is not saying much.
Contrary to their name, these moths are actually quite happy.
While napping in shrubbery, sometimes his snaggletooth gets caught on a leaf.
Augmented by Adamanthia's Ebon Might, this whelpling is ready to face any challenge.
Senega is always ready for a ley crystal snack.
Axel likes to chase bees. No one knows why.
Kromos can often be found napping in sandboxes.
Roggy is the kind of snail that never gives up, no matter how hard things get.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Achievement: |rSlow and Steady Wins the Race|n|cFFFFD200Category: |rDragon Isles

Description_lang: Newsy delivers mail all around the Dragon Isles. She is so quick and reliable that the small holes on the letters she delivers are negligible.
Also known as the Dreamurk, Ysergle slumbered for many long years in the Emrgrled Dream.
Also known as the Lord of Lies, Baa'lial is a master of deceit.
The light of the new legacy illuminates the path you forge.
Blub's heart has always been bigger than her tank, but once the rest of her got too big she had to find a new home. Fortunately, she can now travel with you and see all the marvels of the world!
Solid and dependable, Iggy is always ready for a fierce battle or a gentle metaphor.
Rusziona's newfound courage means she can accompany you on adventures! Nothing in all of Azeroth can stop her! Not even a duck!
Bela has learned some humility since you first met her, so she likely won't boss you around too much.
Ten thousand years spent floating in a time stasis is quite a bit of time to work on material.
Princess Vorquistrasza wants you to know that she appreciates you coming to her birthday party, but is underwhelmed by your gift.
Now that he's no longer sneezing through time, Zhusa is ready to accompany you on your future adventures! Or past adventures! Or future adventures!
Zaleth is looking forward to accompanying you on your adventures. He's already got a list of books he wants to take with him, but Lasztak said he could only bring 2.
Pallibrius is an amazing book because of its wealth of arcane knowledge. Also because of all the pie recipes its previous owner scribbled in the margins.
Posidriss is excited to go on adventures with you, but maybe let them have a nap first?
Somnius is legendary for her ability to sleep through everything except suppertime.
These astral phenomena are rarely sighted due to the speed of the slyvern. It is a good omen to have one following you around.
Loves: Broccoli, playing, and smashing things. Hates: Meat, sleeping, and mean titan keepers who won't let you smash things.
Gill'dan earned his great power by drinking the blood of a demon, which would also have turned his scales green had they not already been that color.
This eye has witnessed untold horrors, and these fangs may be responsible for a few of their own.
He seems to be very angry, but it's possible he's just hungry.
DEFECTIVE; REFUSES TO KILL. MARK FOR IMMEDIATE DESTRUCTION OR SALE TO LESS INTELLIGENT ENTITY.
A war-obsessed world turned her into a weapon... but they couldn't break her spirit.
A lifetime of servitude to Anub'arak, then the Lich King, and now... you!
With a nose for secrets, Tobias is ready to be by the side of super sleuths.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Achievement:|r Community Rumor Mill|n|cFFFFD200Event:|r Secrets of Azeroth

Description_lang: Fyrn will be the first one to show up at your birthday party and the last to leaf.
Feel the chill nipping at your toes! A menace of Azeroth, now in festive blue and travel-size!
Though this little one's flight training has yet to be completed, their playfulness and enthusiasm are already fully grown.
As heir to the Lord of Outland, Maggz has always shared his family's love of violence and power. He just happens to be even more in love with pet treats.
The first thing you might notice about this creature is its huge expressive eyes. This is a mistake. Instead focus on its razor-sharp claws.
Keep it out of your backpack or it will eat all your food and then take a nap.
Sapnibblers are always up for a game of hide and squeak.
This little one likes cheese, but most fawn do.
As younglings, these critters need a lot of naps. Fortunately, adventurers' backpacks make good napping spots.
If you think the skunks of the Emerald Dream smell bad, pray that you never smell the skunks of the Emerald Nightmare.
When enemy combatants fly overhead, there's only one thing to do. Duck.
At a young age Aura donned her magic hat, took her crystal staff, and set off for adventure into the unknown.
The duck of your dreams... or perhaps someone else's dreams.
If you ever have an outdoor feast in the Emerald Dream, look out for wild blueloos. A blueloo won't steal your picinic basket, but it will politely ask for some snacks.
Compared to a fully grown dreamborne scarab, this is the lesser of two weevils.
Be sure to sleep with some grass under your pillow so you can give this critter a snack while you dream.
Since you rescued her from Larodar, this grateful little doe hasn't stopped following you around.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Achievement:|r "Don't Let the Doe Hit You On the Way Out"|n

Description_lang: It is said that some animals dream in black and white. This animal only dreams in green.
This creature could sleep through another Cataclysm.
Snoozles was once given a choice between life in the timeless beautiful snowfields and life in a warm home with pet treats. We know which one he chose.
Rescued from the Druids of the Flame's onslaught upon the Emerald Dream, this juvenile faerie dragon has taken a liking to you -- and to your food. Don't leave your snacks unattended!
Seedles burrow beneath plants in the emerald dreams and nibble at their roots.
Dustites scavenge among the roots of great trees for any small leavings they can find.
Dream on. Dream until your dream comes true!
These creatures live in bushes and near trees, but they sleep so soundly they're practically invisible. If you want to interrupt their dreaming, you'd best bring friends.
Such toof. Such snaggle.
A brown dream badger is a rare sight. Not so rare a smell though.
Snoots has a supernatural sense of smell. It's not any better than normal, it's just supernatural.
Elmer once ate a whole cake all by himself. It wasn't even his cake.
What Spruce lacks in speed, she makes up for with sheer stubbornness.
Juniper's unique coloration makes it hard to hide from predators in the Emerald Dream's lush green foliage. She therefore made the wise decision to travel with you instead.
Is it a snail? Is it a dream? Is it the dream of a sleeping snail?
Wyvern whelps are sleepy by nature. The dreams of wyvern whelps are doubly so.
When she grows up, Mitzy wants to guide Greatfather Winter's sleigh just like Metzen, her famous dad. Until then, she's more than happy to come with you on your adventures.
Tell them that I am free of my father's madness, and I will be free of them as well. I am to be left alone: this will be my first and only warning. - Wrathion
Teele's grandparents told him they were the mice that discovered Azeroth. They were also champion fibbers.
When he's not hanging out with Harth Stonebrew or winning competitions at the tavern, Sarge loves to stow away in the backpacks of visiting adventurers.
Though fully-grown maidenbugs are able to fly, Nelle is just a bit too young for that. She's happy to skitter alongside you all the same.
Farmers will often release maidenbugs to battle the pests that threaten their crops. Buggsy was so good at this that she decided to go pro.
Of all the shades and colors of ducklings that come forth in the spring, the most prized are the pink ones. There are many theories about why, but it's likely just because pink is awesome.
Yellow maidenbugs are often mistaken for other yellow insects. This happens even more often to Beetriz, and she doesn't understand why.
Even Nirobin, a self-proclaimed genius of the highest caliber, could not deny the cuteness of his arcane creation.
It is bewildering how the most arrogant and stuck up of the Azerothian Archivists can't help but create the most adorable arcane familiars. Perhaps Nirobin does have a soft side...
Because it's her favorite holiday, Hoplet wears her Lunar Festival outfit year-ound.
Glamrok followed you back to the ship one day after a particularly good plunder, sensing your keen knack for treasure-finding.
Where do all of the bubbles come from? What are they made of? Perhaps some mysteries are best left unexplored.
It doesn't seem to know where it is, but it's happy to be here!
The needle in Pokee's eye isn't exactly comfortable fashion, but he's stuck with it.
Weighed down by all the loot he has plundered. He could share the burden he carries but it turns out he's a little shellfish.
Once tenacious and terrible, the riverpaw slaughtered weaker enemies without hesitation.
Made from the bits and pieces of vanquished abominations, light magic, and just a pinch of nostalgia.
The faded memory of an Onyxian whelpling, this young dragon has decided that it wants to follow in its own footsteps.
Awww, aren't her pedipalps adorable?
Many arachnids are left to fend for themselves after hatching. It's a common topic in spider therapy.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Pet Battle: |rAzj-Kahet, City of Threads, Hallowfall, Shadowvein Extraction Site, The Ringing Deeps|n

Description_lang: Tough burrowing claws make it easy for arachnids to get around subterranean areas. But it's a boring life.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Pet Battle: |rAzj-Kahet, City of Threads, Hallowfall, Shadowvein Extraction Site, The Ringing Deeps

Description_lang: Graduation from spiderling to fully-fledged spider monster is far off for this young arachnoid.
Finally caught a blind cave skipper. He flopped helplessly for twenty minutes and then let out a burp. Great companion he is!
These silkie chickens were taken aboard airships by those departing the Arathi Empire in pursuit of their emperor's prophetic vision.
Free-range chickens are difficult to take care of in Hallowfall, what with all the shadow monsters and fish people.
Someday, his heavy footfalls and ferocious roar will match his name. Until then, Thunder remains a bolt of cuteness and loyalty.
The Imperial Lynx hails from the shore of the far-flung Arathi Empire, where they serve as fierce and loyal companions and mounts for citizens.
The toes! The huge toe beans! The huge toe beans are not for eating!
This treasured lynx is a firm supporter of no changes.
The Imperial Lynx is known for being stubborn and moody, but fiercely loyal to those they form bonds with.
This hallowed firefly's glow scours the darkness, a welcome omen for the Arathi living in Hallowfall.
Woah there pardner. Were really about to buzz by without saying howdy?
He's a little jumpy... especially around the face.
Not a squid, nor a kid, the scootlefish prefers to keep its ink to itself except under dire circumstances.
Restoring hope to those lost in the darkness comes with its just rewards. Like cute frog friends.
She'll try spinning, that's a good trick.
He hears little hearts melting. Faster now!
Web ball! Stone of reality! Web ball! Stone of reality!
A bug? Wait a minute, no, it's a small friendly spider!
Cute at this size, the humble scootlefish poses a real threat to ships when it grows larger.
Known to dissolve most materials, use extreme caution when approaching this caustic ooze!
The perfect pet if you love stepping on something wet in the middle of the night.
If you hold this up to your ear, you can hear whispers of the Old Gods. Just like a seashell!
The early worms get the bird.
Sweet is the black blood. It tastes of wars past, and wars to come.
Most people don't find congealed blood particularly appetizing. Bloodticks, though...
Imagine being so slow moving that moss grows on your back. Couldn't be me.
Awww, aren't it's fuzzy little pedipalps cute?
The next time you're sitting in the dark and feel something brush against your heel, don't worry! It's just Fuzzy.
I jump, Jon. It's what I do.
Someone once mistook Fringe for an azerite node. He's too young to remember azerite, though.
Though eye-catching, their namesake coloration is rubbish for camouflage. The blind skiplings couldn't care less.
Watch Skippy swim, and then watch him run. The perfect amphibian. Sorry, frogs.
The wily fish has never been caught at the end of an angler's hook. He was caught a completely different way.
There's a wide world to explore outside of dank caves and underground grottos. Waddles will explore them with you, hand in fin.
Hard to spot in the dark, these worms have taught many adventureres a lesson, when sticking their fingers where they don't belong.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Pet Battle: |rAzj-Kahet, City of Threads, Hallowfall, Shadowvein Extraction Site, The Ringing Deeps

Description_lang: Used both in battle and as pack animals when they're larger, at this size they're only a danger to your ankles.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Pet Battle: |rAzj-Kahet, City of Threads, Hallowfall, Shadowvein Extraction Site, The Ringing Deeps

Description_lang: Lil' Bonechewer loves you, even if you were a worm. Especially if you were a worm.
This one may lack the size and color of it's famed cousin, but it can still pack a punch.

It's a bird! It's a gyrocopter! No wait, it's something way worse. Run.
It's not the most original anti-hero name. But it promises to be a compelling crossover.
This dark-shelled monster thrives in shadows. It's where he does all his best thinking.
Is it possible to drink bones? Not without a positive mental attitude it's not!
The green glow of this firefly is seen as an ill-omen for those who travel in darkness.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Pet Battle: |rDornogal, Hallowfall, Isle of Dorn, The Ringing Deeps

Description_lang: The flickering of these lightbugs is said to bring an unnatural and eerie calm to travelers and predators alike.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Pet Battle: |rAzj-Kahet, City of Threads, Hallowfall, Shadowvein Extraction Site, The Ringing Deeps

Description_lang: Though their light is sometimes mistaken for the glow of toxic substances or dark magic, nerubians and Arathi alike find these insects hauntingly beautiful.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Pet Battle: |rAzj-Kahet, City of Threads, Hallowfall, Shadowvein Extraction Site, The Ringing Deeps

Description_lang: In a miracle of dreams and wishes, Waxwick awoke and climbed off a kobold's head to pursue her own path.
Not to be kept indoors if you live in a wooden house.
Look out! He's comin' right for us! Gradually!
In the depths of the Endless Sea, strange thalassic horrors lurk. Not this fella, though. He's completely normal.
Found predominately underground, some of them prefer the surface. But that's none of my business.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Pet Battle: |rAzj-Kahet, City of Threads, Hallowfall, Isle of Dorn, The Ringing Deeps

Description_lang: The sound of the troglofrog echoing throughout deep caverns sounds almost like... ragtime music?
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Pet Battle: |rAzj-Kahet, City of Threads, Deepforge Golemworks, Hallowfall, Isle of Dorn, The Ringing Deeps

Description_lang: Brightly colored means do not touch. Red is nature's warning light!
Protosheep spend winters bereft their flowers. When the seasons turn, the plains are filled with a variety of earthy, sweet scents.
These lambs savor a journey to the beaches of Khaz Algar to rest in warm sands.
Counting sheep to a dream of springtime.
Mosswools appreciate a seasonal shear.
Expert Earthen florists are capable of arranging beautiful floral patterns upon the backs of protosheep.
The softest and fluffiest protosheep made of the softest and fluffiest soil.
Fungal lashers are typically violent and carnivorous. This diminuative variety is better suited to shyly flail its limbs against fellow small fry.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Pet Battle: |rHallowfall, Isle of Dorn, The Ringing Deeps

Description_lang: These highly destructive pests are known to destroy crops in Hallowfall.
The alluring twin mushroom cap colors of these fungal creatures attracts sentient and beastial victims alike.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Pet Battle: |rHallowfall, Isle of Dorn, The Ringing Deeps

Description_lang: Please keep your blightbud on a leash at all times! They are notorious for the havoc they can wreak on unprotected gardens.

Part lean, mean candle-throwing machine. Part adventurer wannabe. All kobold.
Alwaise raring to test his mettle against new opponents.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Drop:|r Delve's Bountiful Coffer and Hidden Trove|n

Description_lang: The grand horns of these beasts spark jealousy in other horned grazing animals.
Earthen ranchers keep a variety of horned beasts for labor and company. None are so proud as the ramolith.
Protorams leave behind stony dust as they frolic, battle, and rest.
Young protorams love to play and bluff charge. They also love to actually charge.
One kobyss's meal is another adventurer's bestie.

The shadowy creature has been following Sir Finley Mrgglton around ever since he happened upon it during one of his expeditions. Having grown quite fond of the tenebrous friend, Sir Finley won't part with it easily.
These swarms of void energy cannot persist in Beledar's light.
The swooping horns of protorams bear the scars of every charge.
They loves sand. It's coarse, and it gets everywhere.
Ancient Gorian blood runs through Marrlok's veins. As far as anyone knows, his desire to rest for long stretches of time on a sunny beach keeps his imperial ambitions in check.
She sees you when you're sleeping.
Maybe give up! Maybe surrender!
Delivers the goods while also looking good.
Now that is one spicy bee!
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200World Quest: |rHome Is Where the Candle Is|n|cFFFFD200Zone: |rThe Ringing Deeps

Description_lang: So wrinkly!! So scrunchy!!
Capable of sensing vibrations and tremors nearly a mile away, these young moles tend to burrow at the first sign of mortal danger.
Even hard sediment poses little challenge to the digging claws of these critters.
She's got a schnoz for sniffin'!
This snuffling is minty fresh!
THE BEES ARE ON FIRE NOW?
This little yak is far snugglier than most of it's kin. And slightly less smelly!
It is said that the Astral Emperor wove these creatures from the stuff of the stars themselves. It is also said that he used only the cutest star-stuff.
Raised as living tanks for Anub'azal's army, Raku-Ush's battleshells are surprisingly affectionate. Who's a good beetle?
When you tell a bad joke, he'll be there to let you know.
A Stormrider's stormrook can not only navigate extreme winds with grace but can also conjure fierce tempests to defend themselves.
Emberrooks are the rarest and most aggressive of the rook slementals.
A full-sized stormrook's thunder can be heard for miles. The chirps of this small spark sound like a faulty electrical device.
More than a typical turtle, he's a hero in a half shell!
Lil' Flameo is ready to drop foolish pets if they get in the way.
No longer lost or lonely, your faithful companion has decided that by your side is the best place to be.
Incredibly lifelike, this enchanted wax statue could pass for a real mole. If petting it didn't cause it to melt, that is.
One hero's trash is another kobold's treasure. This unfortunately does not work in reverse.
One shudders to imagine whether the name was based off of what it is... or what it does.
Claudius is known for being brutally honest as well as a great singer. He knows your jewels would look better on him.
Ancient Gorian blood runs through Parrlok's veins. As far as anyone knows, his desire for enjoying pastries and chatting with his friends keeps his imperial ambitions in check.
Gummi baubleworms have an abundance of natural predators as they are known for their rubbery texture and sweet flavors.
